member.name: F:CSCore.AudioSubTypes.MPEG_ADTS_AAC
member.summary: Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) audio in Audio Data Transport Stream (ADTS) format. The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_ADTS_AAC.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral band replication (SBR) or parametric stereo (PS) tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: F:CSCore.AudioSubTypes.MPEG_RAW_AAC
member.summary: MPEG_RAW_AAC
member.remarks: Source wmCodec.h

member.name: F:CSCore.AudioSubTypes.MPEG_LOAS
member.summary: MPEG-4 audio transport stream with a synchronization layer (LOAS) and a multiplex layer (LATM). The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_LOAS. See .
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral SBR or PS tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

If set to true, the connection will be established asynchronously and the constructor will return immediately. Doing that, requires the usage of the event which will notify the caller when the is ready for use. If set to false the constructor will block the current thread as long as it takes to establish the connection.

member.name: M:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioCaptureClient.GetBufferNative(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32@,CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags@,System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Retrieves a pointer to the next available packet of data in the capture endpoint buffer. For more information see .
member.param: A pointer variable into which the method writes the starting address of the next data packet that is available for the client to read.
Variable into which the method writes the frame count (the number of audio frames available in the data packet). The client should either read the entire data packet or none of it.
Variable into which the method writes the buffer-status flags.
Variable into which the method writes the device position of the first audio frame in the data packet. The device position is expressed as the number of audio frames from the start of the stream.
Variable into which the method writes the value of the performance counter at the time that the audio endpoint device recorded the device position of the first audio frame in the data packet.
member.returns: HRESULT

Variable into which the method writes the buffer-status flags.
Variable into which the method writes the device position of the first audio frame in the data packet. The device position is expressed as the number of audio frames from the start of the stream.
Variable into which the method writes the value of the performance counter at the time that the audio endpoint device recorded the device position of the first audio frame in the data packet.
member.returns: Pointer to a variable which stores the starting address of the next data packet that is available for the client to read.
member.remarks: Use Marshal.Copy to convert the pointer to the buffer into an array.

member.name: T:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags
member.summary: Defines flags that indicate the status of an audio endpoint buffer.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags.DataDiscontinuity
member.summary: The data in the packet is not correlated with the previous packet's device position; this is possibly due to a stream state transition or timing glitch.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags.Silent
member.summary: Treat all of the data in the packet as silence and ignore the actual data values.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientBufferFlags.TimestampError
member.summary: The time at which the device's stream position was recorded is uncertain. Thus, the client might be unable to accurately set the time stamp for the current data packet.

member.name: T:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientSessionFlags
member.summary: The constants indicate characteristics of an audio session associated with the stream. A client can specify these options during the initialization of the stream by through the StreamFlags parameter of the method.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientSessionFlags.SessionFlagsExpireWhenUnowned
member.summary: The session expires when there are no associated streams and owning session control objects holding references.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientSessionFlags.SessionFlagsDisplayHide
member.summary: The volume control is hidden in the volume mixer user interface when the audio session is created. If the session associated with the stream already exists before opens the stream, the volume control is displayed in the volume mixer.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientSessionFlags.SessionFlagsDisplayHideWhenExpired
member.summary: The volume control is hidden in the volume mixer user interface after the session expires.

member.name: T:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientStreamFlags
member.summary: Specifies characteristics that a client can assign to an audio stream during the initialization of the stream.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientStreamFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientStreamFlags.StreamFlagsCrossProcess
member.summary: The audio stream will be a member of a cross-process audio session. For more information, see .

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientStreamFlags.StreamFlagsLoopback
member.summary: The audio stream will operate in loopback mode. For more information, see .

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientStreamFlags.StreamFlagsEventCallback
member.summary: Processing of the audio buffer by the client will be event driven. For more information, see .

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientStreamFlags.StreamFlagsNoPersist
member.summary: The volume and mute settings for an audio session will not persist across system restarts. For more information, see .

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientStreamFlags.StreamFlagsRateAdjust
member.summary: This constant is new in Windows 7. The sample rate of the stream is adjusted to a rate specified by an application. For more information, see .

member.param: The new volume level for the audio session. This parameter is a value in the range 0.0 to 1.0, where 0.0 is silence and 1.0 is full volume (no attenuation).

member.name: M:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.IAudioSessionEvents.OnChannelVolumeChanged(System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Guid@)
member.summary: Notifies the client that the volume level of an audio channel in the session submix has changed.
member.param: The number of channels in the session submix.

An array of volume levels. Each element is a value of type float that specifies the volume level for a particular channel. Each volume level is a value in the range 0.0 to 1.0, where 0.0 is silence and 1.0 is full volume (no attenuation). The number of elements in the array is specified by the ChannelCount parameter.
The number of the channel whose volume level changed.
The event context value.
member.returns: HRESULT

member.name: M:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClient.InitializeNative(CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientShareMode,CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.AudioClientStreamFlags,System.Int64,System.Int64,CSCore.WaveFormat,System.Guid)
member.summary: Initializes the audio stream.
member.param: The sharing mode for the connection. Through this parameter, the client tells the audio engine whether it wants to share the audio endpoint device with other clients.
Flags to control creation of the stream.

The buffer capacity as a time value (expressed in 100-nanosecond units). This parameter contains the buffer size that the caller requests for the buffer that the audio application will share with the audio engine (in shared mode) or with the endpoint device (in exclusive mode). If the call succeeds, the method allocates a buffer that is a least this large.

The device period. This parameter can be nonzero only in exclusive mode. In shared mode, always set this parameter to 0. In exclusive mode, this parameter specifies the requested scheduling period for successive buffer accesses by the audio endpoint device. If the requested device period lies outside the range that is set by the device's minimum period and the system's maximum period, then the method clamps the period to that range. If this parameter is 0, the method sets the device period to its default value. To obtain the default device period, call the method. If the stream flag is set and is set as the , then must be nonzero and equal to .
The format descriptor. For more information, see .

A value that identifies the audio session that the stream belongs to. If the identifies a session that has been previously opened, the method adds the stream to that session. If the GUID does not identify an existing session, the method opens a new session and adds the stream to that session. The stream remains a member of the same session for its lifetime. Use to use the default session.
member.returns: HRESULT
member.remarks: For more information, see .

member.summary: Indicates whether the audio endpoint device supports a particular stream format.
member.param: The sharing mode for the stream format. Through this parameter, the client indicates whether it wants to use the specified format in exclusive mode or shared mode.
The stream format to test whether it is supported by the or not.
Retrieves the supported format that is closest to the format that the client specified through the parameter. If is , the will be always null.
member.returns: HRESULT code. If the method returns 0 (= ), the endpoint device supports the specified . If the method returns 1 (= ), the method succeeded with a to the specified . If the method returns 0x88890008 (= ), the method succeeded but the specified format is not supported in exclusive mode. If the method returns anything else, the method failed.
member.remarks: For more information, see .

member.name: T:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DataFlow
member.summary: Defines constants that indicate the direction in which audio data flows between an audio endpoint device and an application.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DataFlow.Render
member.summary: Audio rendering stream. Audio data flows from the application to the audio endpoint device, which renders the stream.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DataFlow.Capture
member.summary: Audio capture stream. Audio data flows from the audio endpoint device that captures the stream, to the application.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DataFlow.All
member.summary: Audio rendering or capture stream. Audio data can flow either from the application to the audio endpoint device, or from the audio endpoint device to the application.

member.name: T:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState
member.summary: Indicates the current state of an audio endpoint device.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState.Active
member.summary: The audio endpoint device is active. That is, the audio adapter that connects to the endpoint device is present and enabled. In addition, if the endpoint device plugs into a jack on the adapter, then the endpoint device is plugged in.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState.Disabled
member.summary: The audio endpoint device is disabled. The user has disabled the device in the Windows multimedia control panel, Mmsys.cpl. For more information, see Remarks.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState.NotPresent
member.summary: he audio endpoint device is not present because the audio adapter that connects to the endpoint device has been removed from the system, or the user has disabled the adapter device in Device Manager.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState.UnPlugged
member.summary: The audio endpoint device is unplugged. The audio adapter that contains the jack for the endpoint device is present and enabled, but the endpoint device is not plugged into the jack. Only a device with jack-presence detection can be in this state.

member.name: F:CSCore.CoreAudioAPI.DeviceState.All
member.summary: Includes audio endpoint devices in all statesactive, disabled, not present, and unplugged.

member.name: M:CSCore.DirectSound.DirectSoundBuffer.LockNative(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.IntPtr@,System.Int32@,System.IntPtr@,System.Int32@,CSCore.DirectSound.DSBLock)
member.summary: Readies all or part of the buffer for a data write and returns pointers to which data can be written.
member.param: Offset, in bytes, from the start of the buffer to the point where the lock begins. This parameter is ignored if is specified in the parameter.
Size, in bytes, of the portion of the buffer to lock. The buffer is conceptually circular, so this number can exceed the number of bytes between and the end of the buffer.
Receives a pointer to the first locked part of the buffer.
Receives the number of bytes in the block at . If this value is less than , the lock has wrapped and points to a second block of data at the beginning of the buffer.
Receives a pointer to the second locked part of the capture buffer. If is returned, the parameter points to the entire locked portion of the capture buffer.
Receives the number of bytes in the block at . If is , this value is zero.
Flags modifying the lock event.
member.returns: DSResult

member.name: T:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBPlayFlags
member.summary: Flags specifying how to play a .
member.remarks: For more information, see .

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBPlayFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBPlayFlags.Looping
member.summary: After the end of the audio buffer is reached, play restarts at the beginning of the buffer. Play continues until explicitly stopped. This flag must be set when playing a primary buffer.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBPlayFlags.LocHardware
member.summary: Play this voice in a hardware buffer only. If the hardware has no available voices and no voice management flags are set, the call to fails. This flag cannot be combined with .

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBPlayFlags.LocSoftware
member.summary: Play this voice in a software buffer only. This flag cannot be combined with or any voice management flag.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBPlayFlags.TerminateByTime
member.summary: If the hardware has no available voices, a currently playing nonlooping buffer will be stopped to make room for the new buffer. The buffer prematurely terminated is the one with the least time left to play.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBPlayFlags.TerminateByDistance
member.summary: If the hardware has no available voices, a currently playing buffer will be stopped to make room for the new buffer. The buffer prematurely terminated will be selected from buffers that have the buffer's flag set and are beyond their maximum distance. If there are no such buffers, the method fails.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBPlayFlags.TerminateByPriority
member.summary: If the hardware has no available voices, a currently playing buffer will be stopped to make room for the new buffer. The buffer prematurely terminated will be the one with the lowest priority as set by the priority parameter passed to for the buffer.

member.name: T:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCaps
member.summary: Describes the capabilities of a DirectSound buffer object. It is used by the property.
member.remarks: For more information, see .

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCaps.Size
member.summary: Size of the structure, in bytes. This member must be initialized before the structure is used.
member.remarks: Use the method to determine the size.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCaps.Flags
member.summary: Flags that specify buffer-object capabilities.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCaps.BufferBytes
member.summary: Size of this buffer, in bytes.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCaps.UnlockTransferRate
member.summary: The rate, in kilobytes per second, at which data is transferred to the buffer memory when is called. High-performance applications can use this value to determine the time required for to execute. For software buffers located in system memory, the rate will be very high because no processing is required. For hardware buffers, the rate might be slower because the buffer might have to be downloaded to the sound card, which might have a limited transfer rate.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCaps.PlayCpuOverhead
member.summary: The processing overhead as a percentage of main processor cycles needed to mix this sound buffer. For hardware buffers, this member will be zero because the mixing is performed by the sound device. For software buffers, this member depends on the buffer format and the speed of the system processor.

member.name: T:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags
member.summary: Flags that specify buffer-object capabilities.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.PrimaryBuffer
member.summary: The buffer is a primary buffer.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.Static
member.summary: The buffer is in on-board hardware memory.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.LocHardware
member.summary: The buffer uses hardware mixing.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.LocSoftware
member.summary: The buffer is in software memory and uses software mixing.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.Control3D
member.summary: The buffer has 3D control capability.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.ControlFrequency
member.summary: The buffer has frequency control capability.

member.summary: The buffer has pan control capability.

member.summary: The buffer has volume control capability.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.ControlPositionNotify
member.summary: The buffer has position notification capability.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.ControlEffect
member.summary: The buffer supports effects processing.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.StickyFocus
member.summary: The buffer has sticky focus. If the user switches to another application not using DirectSound, the buffer is still audible. However, if the user switches to another DirectSound application, the buffer is muted.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.GlobalFocus
member.summary: The buffer is a global sound buffer. With this flag set, an application using DirectSound can continue to play its buffers if the user switches focus to another application, even if the new application uses DirectSound. For more information, see .

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.GetCurrentPosition2
member.summary: The buffer uses the new behavior of the play cursor when is called. For more information, see .

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.Mute3DAtMaxDistance
member.summary: The sound is reduced to silence at the maximum distance. The buffer will stop playing when the maximum distance is exceeded, so that processor time is not wasted. Applies only to software buffers.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.LocDefer
member.summary: The buffer can be assigned to a hardware or software resource at play time, or when is called.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSBufferCapsFlags.TruePlayPosition
member.summary: Force to return the buffer's true play position. This flag is only valid in Windows Vista.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSCapabilitiesFlags.EmulatedDriver
member.summary: The device does not have a DirectSound driver installed, so it is being emulated through the waveform-audio functions. Performance degradation should be expected.

member.summary: Driver is certified for DirectSound.

member.name: T:CSCore.DirectSound.DSCooperativeLevelType
member.summary: Defines cooperative levels which can be set by calling the method.
member.remarks: For more information, see .

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSCooperativeLevelType.Normal
member.summary: Sets the normal level. This level has the smoothest multitasking and resource-sharing behavior, but because it does not allow the primary buffer format to change, output is restricted to the default 8-bit format.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSCooperativeLevelType.Priority
member.summary: Sets the priority level. Applications with this cooperative level can call the SetFormat and Compact methods.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSCooperativeLevelType.Exclusive
member.summary: For DirectX 8.0 and later, has the same effect as . For previous versions, sets the application to the exclusive level. This means that when it has the input focus, the application will be the only one audible; sounds from applications with the GlobalFocus flag set will be muted. With this level, it also has all the privileges of the DSSCL_PRIORITY level. DirectSound will restore the hardware format, as specified by the most recent call to the SetFormat method, after the application gains the input focus.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSCooperativeLevelType.WritePrimary
member.summary: Sets the write-primary level. The application has write access to the primary buffer. No secondary buffers can be played. This level cannot be set if the DirectSound driver is being emulated for the device; that is, if the GetCaps method returns the DSCAPS_EMULDRIVER flag in the DSCAPS structure.

member.summary: The requested COM interface is not available.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.NoVirtualization
member.summary: The buffer was created, but another 3D algorithm was substituted.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.Incomplete
member.summary: The method succeeded, but not all the optional effects were obtained.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.Unsupported
member.summary: The function called is not supported at this time.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.Generic
member.summary: An undetermined error occurred inside the DirectSound subsystem.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.AccessDenied
member.summary: The request failed because access was denied.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.InvalidParam
member.summary: An invalid parameter was passed to the returning function.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.Allocated
member.summary: The request failed because resources, such as a priority level, were already in use by another caller.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.ControlUnavail
member.summary: The buffer control (volume, pan, and so on) requested by the caller is not available. Controls must be specified when the buffer is created, using the member of .

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.InvalidCall
member.summary: This function is not valid for the current state of this object.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.PrioLevelNeeded
member.summary: A cooperative level of or higher is required.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.BadFormat
member.summary: The specified wave format is not supported.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.NoDriver
member.summary: No sound driver is available for use, or the given GUID is not a valid DirectSound device ID.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.AlreadyInitialized
member.summary: The object is already initialized.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.BufferLost
member.summary: The buffer memory has been lost and must be restored.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.OtherAppHasPrio
member.summary: Another application has a higher priority level, preventing this call from succeeding.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.Uninitialized
member.summary: The method has not been called or has not been called successfully before other methods were called.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.BufferTooSmall
member.summary: The buffer size is not great enough to enable effects processing.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.DirectSound8Required
member.summary: A DirectSound object of class CLSID_DirectSound8 or later is required for the requested functionality.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSResult.SendLoop

member.summary: The audio is passed through directly, without being configured for speakers.

member.summary: The audio is played through headphones.

member.summary: The audio is played through a single speaker.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSSpeakerConfigurations.Surround
member.summary: The audio is played through surround speakers.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSSpeakerConfigurations.FivePointOne
member.summary: The audio is played through a home theater speaker arrangement of five surround speakers with a subwoofer.
member.remarks: Obsolete 5.1 setting. Use instead.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSSpeakerConfigurations.SevenPointOne
member.summary: The audio is played through a home theater speaker arrangement of seven surround speakers with a subwoofer.
member.remarks: Obsolete 7.1 setting. Use instead.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSSpeakerConfigurations.SevenPointOneSurround
member.summary: The audio is played through a home theater speaker arrangement of seven surround speakers with a subwoofer. This value applies to Windows XP SP2 or later.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSSpeakerConfigurations.FivePointOneSurround
member.summary: The audio is played through a home theater speaker arrangement of five surround speakers with a subwoofer. This value applies to Windows Vista or later.

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSSpeakerConfigurations.SevenPointOneWide
member.summary: The audio is played through a wide speaker arrangement of seven surround speakers with a subwoofer. ( is still defined, but is obsolete as of Windows XP SP 2. Use instead.)

member.name: F:CSCore.DirectSound.DSSpeakerConfigurations.FivePointOneBack
member.summary: The audio is played through a speaker arrangement of five surround speakers with a subwoofer. ( is still defined, but is obsolete as of Windows Vista. Use instead.)

member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputDataBufferFlags.SyncPoint
member.summary: The beginning of the data is a synchronization point.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputDataBufferFlags.Time
member.summary: The buffer's time stamp is valid. The buffer's indicated time length is valid.

member.summary: The buffer's indicated time length is valid.

member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputStatusFlags.AcceptData
member.summary: The stream accepts data.

member.name: T:CSCore.DMO.InputStreamInfoFlags
member.summary: Defines flags that describe an input stream. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd375502(v=vs.85).aspx.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputStreamInfoFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputStreamInfoFlags.WholeSamples
member.summary: The stream contains whole samples. Samples do not span multiple buffers, and buffers do not contain partial samples.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputStreamInfoFlags.SingleSamplePerBuffer
member.summary: Each buffer contains exactly one sample.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputStreamInfoFlags.FixedSampleSize
member.summary: The stream is discardable. Within calls to IMediaObject::ProcessOutput, the DMO can discard data for this stream without copying it to an output buffer.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.InputStreamInfoFlags.HoldsBuffers
member.summary: The DMO performs lookahead on the incoming data, and may hold multiple input buffers for this stream.

member.name: T:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags
member.summary: Defines flags that describe an output buffer. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd375508(v=vs.85).aspx.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags.SyncPoint
member.summary: The beginning of the data is a synchronization point. A synchronization point is a random access point. For encoded video, this a sample that can be used as a decoding start point (key frame). For uncompressed audio or video, every sample is a synchronization point.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags.Time
member.summary: The buffer's time stamp is valid. The buffer's indicated time length is valid.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags.TimeLength
member.summary: The buffer's indicated time length is valid.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputDataBufferFlags.Incomplete
member.summary: There is still input data available for processing, but the output buffer is full.

member.name: T:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags
member.summary: Flags that describe an output stream. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd375509(v=vs.85).aspx.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags.WholeSamples
member.summary: The stream contains whole samples. Samples do not span multiple buffers, and buffers do not contain partial samples.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags.SingleSamplePerBuffer
member.summary: Each buffer contains exactly one sample.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags.FixedSampleSize
member.summary: All the samples in this stream are the same size.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags.Discardable
member.summary: The stream is discardable. Within calls to IMediaObject::ProcessOutput, the DMO can discard data for this stream without copying it to an output buffer.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.OutputStreamInfoFlags.Optional
member.summary: The stream is optional. An optional stream is discardable. Also, the application can ignore this stream entirely; it does not have to set the media type for the stream. Optional streams generally contain additional information, or data not needed by all applications.

member.name: T:CSCore.DMO.ProcessOutputFlags
member.summary: Defines flags that specify output processing requests. See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd375511(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.ProcessOutputFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.ProcessOutputFlags.DiscardWhenNoBuffer
member.summary: Discard the output when the pointer to the output buffer is NULL.

member.name: M:CSCore.DMO.MediaObject.DiscontinuityNative(System.Int32)
member.summary: Signals a discontinuity on the specified input stream.
member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.
member.returns: HRESULT
member.remarks: A discontinuity represents a break in the input. A discontinuity might occur because no more data is expected, the format is changing, or there is a gap in the data. After a discontinuity, the DMO does not accept further input on that stream until all pending data has been processed. The application should call the method until none of the streams returns the (see ) flag. This method might fail if it is called before the client sets the input and output types on the DMO.

member.name: M:CSCore.DMO.MediaObject.Discontinuity(System.Int32)
member.summary: Signals a discontinuity on the specified input stream.
member.param: Zero-based index of an input stream on the DMO.
member.remarks: A discontinuity represents a break in the input. A discontinuity might occur because no more data is expected, the format is changing, or there is a gap in the data. After a discontinuity, the DMO does not accept further input on that stream until all pending data has been processed. The application should call the method until none of the streams returns the (see ) flag. This method might fail if it is called before the client sets the input and output types on the DMO.

member.name: M:CSCore.DMO.MediaObject.AllocateStreamingResourcesNative
member.summary: Allocates any resources needed by the DMO. Calling this method is always optional.

member.summary: Subtype GUID of the stream.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.MediaType.FixedSizeSamples
member.summary: If TRUE, samples are of a fixed size. This field is informational only. For audio, it is generally set to TRUE. For video, it is usually TRUE for uncompressed video and FALSE for compressed video.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.MediaType.TemporalCompression
member.summary: If TRUE, samples are compressed using temporal (interframe) compression. A value of TRUE indicates that not all frames are key frames. This field is informational only.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.MediaType.SampleSize
member.summary: Size of the sample, in bytes. For compressed data, the value can be zero.

member.summary: GUID specifying the format type. The pbFormat member points to the corresponding format structure. (see )

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.MediaType.CbFormat
member.summary: Size of the format block of the media type.

member.name: F:CSCore.DMO.MediaType.PtrFormat
member.summary: Pointer to the format structure. The structure type is specified by the formattype member. The format structure must be present, unless formattype is GUID_NULL or FORMAT_None.

member.name: T:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamCapsFlags
member.summary: Defines the characteristics of a .

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamCapsFlags.None
member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamCapsFlags.IsReadable
member.summary: The byte stream can be read.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamCapsFlags.IsWriteable
member.summary: The byte stream can be written to.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamCapsFlags.IsSeekable
member.summary: The byte stream can be seeked.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamCapsFlags.IsRemote
member.summary: The byte stream is from a remote source, such as a network.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamCapsFlags.IsDirectory
member.summary: The byte stream represents a file directory.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamCapsFlags.HasSlowSeek
member.summary: Seeking within this stream might be slow. For example, the byte stream might download from a network.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamCapsFlags.IsPartiallyDownloaded
member.summary: The byte stream is currently downloading data to a local cache. Read operations on the byte stream might take longer until the data is completely downloaded.This flag is cleared after all of the data has been downloaded. If the flag is also set, it means the byte stream must download the entire file sequentially. Otherwise, the byte stream can respond to seek requests by restarting the download from a new point in the stream.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamCapsFlags.ShareWrite
member.summary: Another thread or process can open this byte stream for writing. If this flag is present, the length of the byte stream could change while it is being read.
member.remarks: Requires Windows 7 or later.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamCapsFlags.DoesNotUseNetwork
member.summary: The byte stream is not currently using the network to receive the content. Networking hardware may enter a power saving state when this bit is set.
member.remarks: Requires Windows 8 or later.

member.name: T:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamSeekOrigin
member.summary: Specifies the origin for a seek request.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamSeekOrigin.Begin
member.summary: The seek position is specified relative to the start of the stream.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFByteStreamSeekOrigin.Current
member.summary: The seek position is specified relative to the current read/write position in the stream.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFMediaSourceCharacteristics.IsLive
member.summary: This flag indicates a data source that runs constantly, such as a live presentation. If the source is stopped and then restarted, there will be a gap in the content.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFMediaSourceCharacteristics.CanSeek
member.summary: The media source supports seeking.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFMediaSourceCharacteristics.CanPause
member.summary: The source can pause.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFMediaSourceCharacteristics.HasSlowSeek
member.summary: The media source downloads content. It might take a long time to seek to parts of the content that have not been downloaded.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFMediaSourceCharacteristics.HasMultiplePresentations
member.summary: The media source delivers a playlist, which might contain more than one entry.
member.remarks: Requires Windows 7 or later.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFMediaSourceCharacteristics.CanSkipForward
member.summary: The media source can skip forward in the playlist. Applies only if the flag is present.
member.remarks: Requires Windows 7 or later.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFMediaSourceCharacteristics.CanSkipBackward
member.summary: The media source can skip backward in the playlist. Applies only if the flag is present.
member.remarks: Requires Windows 7 or later.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFMediaSourceCharacteristics.DoesNotUseNetwork
member.summary: The media source is not currently using the network to receive the content. Networking hardware may enter a power saving state when this bit is set.
member.remarks: Requires Windows 8 or later.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.Cb
member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.LastTimestampReceived
member.summary: The time stamp of the most recent sample given to the sink writer. The sink writer updates this value each time the application calls .

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.LastTimestampEncoded
member.summary: The time stamp of the most recent sample to be encoded. The sink writer updates this value whenever it calls IMFTransform::ProcessOutput on the encoder.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.LastTimestampProcessed
member.summary: The time stamp of the most recent sample given to the media sink. The sink writer updates this value whenever it calls IMFStreamSink::ProcessSample on the media sink.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.LastStreamTickReceived
member.summary: The time stamp of the most recent stream tick. The sink writer updates this value whenever the application calls .

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.LastSinkSampleRequest
member.summary: The system time of the most recent sample request from the media sink. The sink writer updates this value whenever it receives an MEStreamSinkRequestSample event from the media sink. The value is the current system time.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.NumSamplesReceived
member.summary: The number of samples received.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.NumSamplesEncoded
member.summary: The number of samples encoded.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.NumSamplesProcessed
member.summary: The number of samples given to the media sink.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.NumStreamTicksReceived
member.summary: The number of stream ticks received.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.ByteCountQueued
member.summary: The amount of data, in bytes, currently waiting to be processed.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.ByteCountProcessed
member.summary: The total amount of data, in bytes, that has been sent to the media sink.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.NumOutstandingSinkSampleRequests
member.summary: The number of pending sample requests.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.AverageSampleRateReceived
member.summary: The average rate, in media samples per 100-nanoseconds, at which the application sent samples to the sink writer.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.AverageSampleRateEncoded
member.summary: The average rate, in media samples per 100-nanoseconds, at which the sink writer sent samples to the encoder.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSinkWriterStatistics.AverageSampleRateProcessed
member.summary: The average rate, in media samples per 100-nanoseconds, at which the sink writer sent samples to the media sink.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSourceReaderFlags.NativeMediaTypeChanged
member.summary: The native format has changed for one or more streams. The native format is the format delivered by the media source before any decoders are inserted.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSourceReaderFlags.CurrentMediaTypeChanged
member.summary: The current media has type changed for one or more streams. To get the current media type, call the method.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSourceReaderFlags.StreamTick
member.summary: There is a gap in the stream. This flag corresponds to an MEStreamTick event from the media source.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSourceReaderFlags.AllEffectsRemoved
member.summary: All transforms inserted by the application have been removed for a particular stream. This could be due to a dynamic format change from a source or decoder that prevents custom transforms from being used because they cannot handle the new media type.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFTEnumFlags.SyncDataProcessing
member.summary: The MFT performs synchronous data processing in software. This flag does not apply to hardware transforms.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFTEnumFlags.AsyncDataProcessing
member.summary: The MFT performs asynchronous data processing in software. See . This flag does not apply to hardware transforms.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFTEnumFlags.Hardware
member.summary: The MFT performs hardware-based data processing, using either the AVStream driver or a GPU-based proxy MFT. MFTs in this category always process data asynchronously. See .

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFTEnumFlags.FieldOfUse
member.summary: Must be unlocked by the app before use. For more information, see .

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFTEnumFlags.LocalMFT

member.summary: None

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MediaTypeEqualFlags.MajorTypes
member.summary: The major types are the same.

member.summary: The subtypes are the same, or neither media type has a subtype.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MediaTypeEqualFlags.Data
member.summary: The attributes in one of the media types are a subset of the attributes in the other, and the values of these attributes match, excluding the value of the MF_MT_USER_DATA, MF_MT_FRAME_RATE_RANGE_MIN, and MF_MT_FRAME_RATE_RANGE_MAX attributes.

member.name: F:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MediaTypeEqualFlags.UserData
member.summary: The user data is identical, or neither media type contains user data. User data is specified by the MF_MT_USER_DATA attribute.

member.name: M:CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFSample.GetBufferByIndexNative(System.Int32,CSCore.MediaFoundation.MFMediaBuffer@)
member.summary: Gets a buffer from the sample, by index.
member.param: Index of the buffer. To find the number of buffers in the sample, call . Buffers are indexed from zero.
Receives the instance. The caller must release the object.
member.returns: HRESULT
member.remarks: Note: In most cases, it is safer to use the method. If the sample contains more than one buffer, the method replaces them with a single buffer, copies the original data into that buffer, and returns the new buffer to the caller. The copy operation occurs at most once. On subsequent calls, no data is copied.

If the sample contains more than one buffer, the method replaces them with a single buffer, copies the original data into that buffer, and returns the new buffer to the caller. The copy operation occurs at most once. On subsequent calls, no data is copied.

member.name: P:CSCore.SoundOut.WasapiOut.IsSupportedOnCurrentPlatform
member.summary: Gets a value which indicates whether Wasapi is supported on the current Platform. True means that the current platform supports ; False means that the current platform does not support .

member.name: P:CSCore.SoundOut.WasapiOut.EnableDwmMmcssScheduling
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the Desktop Window Manager (DWM) has to opt in to or out of Multimedia Class Schedule Service (MMCSS) scheduling while the current process is alive.
member.value: True to instruct the Desktop Window Manager to participate in MMCSS scheduling; False to opt out or end participation in MMCSS scheduling.
member.remarks: DWM will be scheduled by the MMCSS as long as any process that called DwmEnableMMCSS to enable MMCSS is active and has not previously called DwmEnableMMCSS to disable MMCSS.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of milliseconds the input is delayed before it is played back, in the range from 0 to 20. The default value is 16 ms.

member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage by which the delay time is modulated by the low-frequency oscillator, in hundredths of a percentage point. Must be in the range from 0 through 100. The default value is 10.

member.name: P:CSCore.Streams.Effects.DmoChorusEffect.Feedback
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of output signal to feed back into the effect's input, in the range from -99 to 99. The default value is 25.

member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency of the LFO, in the range from 0 to 10. The default value is 1.1.

member.name: P:CSCore.Streams.Effects.DmoChorusEffect.Waveform
member.summary: Gets or sets the waveform shape of the LFO. By default, the waveform is a sine.

member.name: P:CSCore.Streams.Effects.DmoChorusEffect.Phase
member.summary: Gets or sets the phase differential between left and right LFOs. The default value is Phase90.

member.name: P:CSCore.Streams.Effects.DmoChorusEffect.WetDryMix
member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio of wet (processed) signal to dry (unprocessed) signal. Must be in the range from 0 through 100 (all wet). The default value is 50.

member.summary: Gets or sets the speed at which compression is stopped after input drops below fThreshold, in the range from 50 ms to 3000 ms. The default value is 200 ms.

member.summary: Gets or sets the point at which compression begins, in decibels, in the range from -60 dB to 0 dB. The default value is -20 dB.

member.name: T:CSCore.Streams.Effects.PitchShifter
member.summary: A pitch shifting effect.
member.remarks:
The internal pitch shifting code is based on the implementation of Stephan M. Bernsee smb@dspdimension.com (see http://www.dspdimension.com) and Michael Knight madmik3@gmail.com (http://sites.google.com/site/mikescoderama/) who translated Stephan's code to C#.
Both gave the explicit permission to republish the code as part of CSCore under the MS-PL. Big thanks!

member.name: P:CSCore.Streams.Effects.PitchShifter.PitchShiftFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the pitch shift factor.
member.value: A pitch shift factor value which is between 0.5 (one octave down) and 2. (one octave up). A value of exactly 1 does not change the pitch.

member.name: P:CSCore.Streams.GainSource.Volume
member.summary: Gets or sets the volume. A value of 1.0 will set the volume to 100%. A value of 0.0 will set the volume to 0%.
member.remarks: Since there is no validation of the value, this property can be used to set the gain value to any value.

member.name: P:CSCore.Streams.GainSource.ClipOverflows
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the method should clip overflows. The default value is true.
member.value: true if the method should clip overflows; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Clipping the overflows means, that all samples which are not in the range from -1 to 1, will be clipped to that range. For example if a sample has a value of 1.3, it will be clipped to a value of 1.0.

member.name: M:CSCore.Streams.GainSource.Read(System.Single[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of samples from the and advances the position within the stream by the number of samples read. After reading the samples, the specified gain value will get applied and the overflows will be clipped (optionally).
member.param: An array of floats. When this method returns, the contains the specified float array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the floats read from the current source.
The zero-based offset in the at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of samples to read from the current source.
member.returns: The total number of samples read into the buffer.

member.name: F:CSCore.AudioEncoding.MPEG_ADTS_AAC
member.summary: Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) audio in Audio Data Transport Stream (ADTS) format. The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_ADTS_AAC.
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral band replication (SBR) or parametric stereo (PS) tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: F:CSCore.AudioEncoding.MPEG_LOAS
member.summary: MPEG-4 audio transport stream with a synchronization layer (LOAS) and a multiplex layer (LATM). The format block is a WAVEFORMATEX structure with wFormatTag equal to WAVE_FORMAT_MPEG_LOAS. See .
member.remarks: The WAVEFORMATEX structure specifies the core AAC-LC sample rate and number of channels, prior to applying spectral SBR or PS tools, if present. No additional data is required after the WAVEFORMATEX structure.

member.name: T:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX
member.summary: Values that are used in activation calls to indicate the execution contexts in which an object is to be run.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER
member.summary: The code that creates and manages objects of this class is a DLL that runs in the same process as the caller of the function specifying the class context.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_HANDLER
member.summary: Indicates a handler dll, which runs on the same process as the caller.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_LOCAL_SERVER
member.summary: Indicates a server executable, which runs on the same machine but on a different process than the caller.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_SERVER16
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_REMOTE_SERVER
member.summary: Indicates a server executable, which runs on a different machine than the caller.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_INPROC_HANDLER16
member.summary: Obsolete.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED1
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED2
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED3
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED4
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_NO_CODE_DOWNLOAD
member.summary: Indicates that code should not be allowed to be downloaded from the Directory Service (if any) or the Internet.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_RESERVED5
member.summary: Reserved.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_NO_CUSTOM_MARSHAL
member.summary: Specify if you want the activation to fail if it uses custom marshalling.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ENABLE_CODE_DOWNLOAD
member.summary: Enables the downloading of code from the directory service or the Internet.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_NO_FAILURE_LOG
member.summary: Indicates that no log messages about activation failure should be written to the Event Log.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_DISABLE_AAA
member.summary: Indicates that activate-as-activator capability is disabled for this activation only.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ENABLE_AAA
member.summary: Indicates that activate-as-activator capability is enabled for this activation only.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_FROM_DEFAULT_CONTEXT
member.summary: Indicates that activation should begin from the default context of the current apartment.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ACTIVATE_32_BIT_SERVER
member.summary: Activate or connect to a 32-bit version of the server; fail if one is not registered.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ACTIVATE_64_BIT_SERVER
member.summary: Activate or connect to a 64 bit version of the server; fail if one is not registered.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ENABLE_CLOAKING
member.summary: When this flag is specified, COM uses the impersonation token of the thread, if one is present, for the activation request made by the thread. When this flag is not specified or if the thread does not have an impersonation token, COM uses the process token of the thread's process for the activation request made by the thread.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_APPCONTAINER
member.summary: Indicates activation is for an app container. Reserved for internal use.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_ACTIVATE_AAA_AS_IU
member.summary: Specify this flag for Interactive User activation behavior for As-Activator servers.

member.name: F:CSCore.Win32.CLSCTX.CLSCTX_PS_DLL
member.summary: Used for loading Proxy/Stub DLLs.

member.summary: Bitwise combination of the and the constants.

member.summary: Bitwise combination of the , the and the constants.

member.summary: Bitwise combination of the and the constants.

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterParameters
member.summary: Defines filter parameters for a source voice.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterParameters.Type
member.summary: The .

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterParameters.Frequency
member.summary: Filter radian frequency calculated as (2 * sin(pi * (desired filter cutoff frequency) / sampleRate)). The frequency must be greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 1.0f. The maximum frequency allowable is equal to the source sound's sample rate divided by six which corresponds to the maximum filter radian frequency of 1. For example, if a sound's sample rate is 48000 and the desired cutoff frequency is the maximum allowable value for that sample rate, 8000, the value for Frequency will be 1.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterParameters.OneOverQ
member.summary: Reciprocal of Q factor. Controls how quickly frequencies beyond Frequency are dampened. Larger values result in quicker dampening while smaller values cause dampening to occur more gradually. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.5f.

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType
member.summary: Indicates the filter type.
member.remarks: Note Note that the DirectX SDK versions of XAUDIO2 do not support the LowPassOnePoleFilter or the HighPassOnePoleFilter.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.LowPassFilter
member.summary: Attenuates (reduces) frequencies above the cutoff frequency.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.BandPassFilter
member.summary: Attenuates frequencies outside a given range.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.HighPassFilter
member.summary: Attenuates frequencies below the cutoff frequency.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.NotchFilter
member.summary: Attenuates frequencies inside a given range.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.LowPassOnePoleFilter
member.summary: XAudio2.8 only: Attenuates frequencies above the cutoff frequency. This is a one-pole filter, and has no effect.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.FilterType.HighPassOnePoleFilter
member.summary: XAudio2.8 only: Attenuates frequencies below the cutoff frequency. This is a one-pole filter, and has no effect.

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback
member.summary: The IXAudio2VoiceCallback interface contains methods that notify the client when certain events happen in a given .

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback.OnVoiceProcessingPassStart(System.Int32)
member.summary: Called during each processing pass for each voice, just before XAudio2 reads data from the voice's buffer queue.
member.param: The number of bytes that must be submitted immediately to avoid starvation. This allows the implementation of just-in-time streaming scenarios; the client can keep the absolute minimum data queued on the voice at all times, and pass it fresh data just before the data is required. This model provides the lowest possible latency attainable with XAudio2. For xWMA and XMA data BytesRequired will always be zero, since the concept of a frame of xWMA or XMA data is meaningless. Note: In a situation where there is always plenty of data available on the source voice, BytesRequired should always report zero, because it doesn't need any samples immediately to avoid glitching.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback.OnVoiceProcessingPassEnd
member.summary: Called just after the processing pass for the voice ends.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback.OnStreamEnd
member.summary: Called when the voice has just finished playing a contiguous audio stream.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback.OnBufferStart(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Called when the voice is about to start processing a new audio buffer.
member.param: Context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback.OnBufferEnd(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Called when the voice finishes processing a buffer.
member.param: Context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback.OnLoopEnd(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Called when the voice reaches the end position of a loop.
member.param: Context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.summary: Called when a critical error occurs during voice processing.
member.param: Context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback
member.summary: Default implementation of the interface.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.ProcessingPassStart
member.summary: Called during each processing pass for each voice, just before XAudio2 reads data from the voice's buffer queue. The only argument passed to the eventhandler is the number of required bytes: The number of bytes that must be submitted immediately to avoid starvation. This allows the implementation of just-in-time streaming scenarios; the client can keep the absolute minimum data queued on the voice at all times, and pass it fresh data just before the data is required. This model provides the lowest possible latency attainable with XAudio2. For xWMA and XMA data BytesRequired will always be zero, since the concept of a frame of xWMA or XMA data is meaningless. Note: In a situation where there is always plenty of data available on the source voice, BytesRequired should always report zero, because it doesn't need any samples immediately to avoid glitching.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.ProcessingPassEnd
member.summary: Called just after the processing pass for the voice ends.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.StreamEnd
member.summary: Called when the voice has just finished playing a contiguous audio stream.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.BufferStart
member.summary: Called when the voice is about to start processing a new audio buffer. The only argument passed to the eventhandler is a context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.BufferEnd
member.summary: Called when the voice finishes processing a buffer. The only argument passed to the eventhandler is a context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.LoopEnd
member.summary: Called when the voice reaches the end position of a loop. The only argument passed to the eventhandler is a context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted.

member.name: E:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceCallback.VoiceError
member.summary: Called when a critical error occurs during voice processing. The first argument passed to the eventhandler is a context pointer that was assigned to the pContext member of the structure when the buffer was submitted. The second argument passed to the eventhandler is the HRESULT error code of the critical error.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceState.SamplesPlayed
member.summary: Total number of samples processed by this voice since it last started, or since the last audio stream ended (as marked with the flag). This total includes samples played multiple times due to looping. Theoretically, if all audio emitted by the voice up to this time is captured, this parameter would be the length of the audio stream in samples. If you specify when you call , this member won't be calculated, and its value is unspecified on return from . takes about one-third as much time to complete when you specify .

member.summary: Caller provided array that will be initialized with the volume level of each source channel present in each destination channel. The array must have at least ( ) elements. member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.DspSettings.DspSettingsNative.DelayTimesPtr
member.summary: Caller provided delay time array, which receives delays for each destination channel in milliseconds. This array must have at least elements. X3DAudio doesn't actually perform the delay. It simply returns the coefficients that may be used to adjust a delay DSP effect placed in the effect chain. The member can be NULL if the flag is not specified when calling . Note This member is only returned when X3DAudio is initialized for stereo output. For typical Xbox 360 usage, it will not return any data at all.

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter
member.summary: Defines a single-point or multiple-point 3D audio source that is used with an arbitrary number of sound channels.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.Cone
member.summary: Gets or sets the sound cone. Used only with single-channel emitters for matrix, LPF (both direct and reverb paths), and reverb calculations. NULL specifies the emitter is omnidirectional.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.OrientFront
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the front direction. This value must be orthonormal with . must be normalized when used. For single-channel emitters without cones is only used for emitter angle calculations. For multi channel emitters or single-channel with cones is used for matrix, LPF (both direct and reverb paths), and reverb calculations.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.OrientTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the top direction. This value must be orthonormal with . is only used with multi-channel emitters for matrix calculations.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in user-defined world units. This value does not affect .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.Velocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the velocity vector in user-defined world units/second. This value is used only for doppler calculations. It does not affect .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.InnerRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to be used for the inner radius calculations. If is 0, then no inner radius is used, but may still be used. This value must be between 0.0f and FLT_MAX.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.InnerRadiusAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to be used for the inner radius angle calculations. This value must be between 0.0f and /4.0 (which equals 45).

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.ChannelCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of emitters defined by the class. Must be greater than 0.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.ChannelRadius
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance from that channels will be placed if is greater than 1. is only used with multi-channel emitters for matrix calculations. Must be greater than or equal to 0.0f.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.ChannelAzimuths
member.summary: Gets or sets the table of channel positions, expressed as an azimuth in radians along the channel radius with respect to the front orientation vector in the plane orthogonal to the top orientation vector. An azimuth of 2* specifies a channel is a low-frequency effects (LFE) channel. LFE channels are positioned at the emitter base and are calculated with respect to only, never . must have at least elements, but can be NULL if = 1. The table values must be within 0.0f to 2*. is used with multi-channel emitters for matrix calculations.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.VolumeCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets the volume-level distance curve, which is used only for matrix calculations. NULL specifies a specialized default curve that conforms to the inverse square law, such that when distance is between 0.0f and 1.0f, no attenuation is applied. When distance is greater than 1.0f, the amplification factor is ( 1.0f)/distance. At a distance of 2.0f, the sound will be at half volume or -6 dB, at a distance of 4.0f, the sound will be at one quarter volume or -12 dB, and so on. and are independent of each other. does not affect LFE channel volume.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.LowFrequencyEffectCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets the LFE roll-off distance curve, or NULL to use default curve: [0.0f, 1.0f], [ 1.0f, 0.0f]. A NULL value for specifies a default curve that conforms to the inverse square law with distances <= clamped to no attenuation. and are independent of each other. does not affect non LFE channel volume.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.LowPassFilterDirectCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets the low-pass filter (LPF) direct-path coefficient distance curve, or NULL to use the default curve: [0.0f, 1.0f], [1.0f, 0.75f]. is only used for LPF direct-path calculations.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.LowPassFilterReverbCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets the LPF reverb-path coefficient distance curve, or NULL to use default curve: [0.0f, 0.75f], [1.0f, 0.75f]. is only used for LPF reverb path calculations.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.ReverbCurve
member.summary: Gets or sets the reverb send level distance curve, or NULL to use default curve: [0.0f, 1.0f], [1.0f, 0.0f].

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.CurveDistanceScaler
member.summary: Gets or sets the curve distance scaler that is used to scale normalized distance curves to user-defined world units, and/or to exaggerate their effect. This does not affect any other calculations. The value must be within the range FLT_MIN to FLT_MAX. is only used for matrix, LPF (both direct and reverb paths), and reverb calculations.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Emitter.DopplerScaler
member.summary: Doppler shift scaler that is used to exaggerate Doppler shift effect. is only used for Doppler calculations and does not affect any other calculations. The value must be within the range 0.0f to FLT_MAX.

member.name: T:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener
member.summary: Defines a point of 3D audio reception.
member.remarks: A listener's front and top vectors must be orthonormal. To be considered orthonormal, a pair of vectors must have a magnitude of 1 +- 1x10-5 and a dot product of 0 +- 1x10-5.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener.OrientFront
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of front direction. When is NULL OrientFront is used only for matrix and delay calculations. When is not NULL OrientFront is used for matrix, LPF (both direct and reverb paths), and reverb calculations. This value must be orthonormal with when used.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener.OrientTop
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of top direction, used only for matrix and delay calculations. This value must be orthonormal with when used.

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener.Position
member.summary: Gets or sets the position in user-defined world units. This value does not affect .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener.Velocity
member.summary: Gets or sets the velocity vector in user-defined world units per second, used only for doppler calculations. This value does not affect .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.X3DAudio.Listener.Cone
member.summary: Gets or sets the to use. Providing a listener cone will specify that additional calculations are performed when determining the volume and filter DSP parameters for individual sound sources. A NULL value specifies an omnidirectional sound and no cone processing is applied. is only used for matrix, LPF (both direct and reverb paths), and reverb calculations.

Pointer to a . The following formats are supported:
8-bit (unsigned) integer PCM
16-bit integer PCM (optimal format for XAudio2)
20-bit integer PCM (either in 24 or 32 bit containers)
24-bit integer PCM (either in 24 or 32 bit containers)
32-bit integer PCM
32-bit float PCM (preferred format after 16-bit integer)
The number of channels in a source voice must be less than or equal to . The sample rate of a source voice must be between and .
that specify the behavior of the source voice. A flag can be or a combination of one or more of the following. Possible values are , and . is not supported on Windows.
Highest allowable frequency ratio that can be set on this voice. The value for this argument must be between and .
Client-provided callback interface, . This parameter is optional and can be null.
List of structures that describe the set of destination voices for the source voice. If is NULL, the send list defaults to a single output to the first mastering voice created.
List of structures that describe an effect chain to use in the source voice. This parameter is optional and can be null.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2.CreateSubmixVoiceNative(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,System.Int32,CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceFlags,System.Int32,System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceSends},System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.EffectChain})
member.summary: Creates and configures a submix voice.
member.param: On success, returns a pointer to the new object.
Number of channels in the input audio data of the submix voice. The must be less than or equal to .
Sample rate of the input audio data of submix voice. This rate must be a multiple of . InputSampleRate must be between and .
Flags that specify the behavior of the submix voice. It can be or .

An arbitrary number that specifies when this voice is processed with respect to other submix voices, if the XAudio2 engine is running other submix voices. The voice is processed after all other voices that include a smaller value and before all other voices that include a larger value. Voices that include the same value are processed in any order. A submix voice cannot send to another submix voice with a lower or equal value. This prevents audio being lost due to a submix cycle.
List of structures that describe the set of destination voices for the submix voice. If is NULL, the send list will default to a single output to the first mastering voice created.
List of structures that describe an effect chain to use in the submix voice. This parameter is optional and can be null.
member.returns: HRESULT

member.summary: Creates and configures a mastering voice.
member.param: If successful, returns a pointer to the new object.

Number of channels the mastering voice expects in its input audio. must be less than or equal to . You can set InputChannels to , which causes XAudio2 to try to detect the system speaker configuration setup.

Sample rate of the input audio data of the mastering voice. This rate must be a multiple of . must be between
and . You can set InputSampleRate to , with the default being determined by the current platform.
Flags that specify the behavior of the mastering voice. Must be 0.

Identifier of the device to receive the output audio. Specifying the default value of NULL (for XAudio2.8) or 0 (for XAudio2.7) causes XAudio2 to select the global default audio device.
On XAudio2.7: Use the and the method to enumerate device. Pass its index (valid range from 0 to ) to the argument. On XAudio2.8: Use the class to enumerate objects. Pass its to the argument.
structure that describes an effect chain to use in the mastering voice, or NULL to use no effects.
The audio stream category to use for this mastering voice.
member.returns: HRESULT

member.summary: Length of the region to be played, in samples. A value of zero means to play the entire buffer, and, in this case, must be zero as well. For more details see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/microsoft.directx_sdk.xaudio2.xaudio2_buffer(v=vs.85).aspx.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2Buffer.LoopBegin
member.summary: First sample of the region to be looped. The value of must be less than + . can be less than . must be 0 if is 0.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2Buffer.LoopLength
member.summary: Length of the loop region, in samples. The value of + must be greater than and less than + . must be zero if is 0. If is not 0 then a loop length of zero indicates the entire sample should be looped.

member.name: F:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2Buffer.LoopCount
member.summary: Number of times to loop through the loop region. This value can be between 0 and . If LoopCount is zero no looping is performed and and must be 0. To loop forever, set to .

member.name: P:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2Voice.Volume
member.summary: Gets or sets the volume of the . The default value is 1.0.
member.remarks: The master volume level is applied at different times depending on the type of voice. For submix and mastering voices the volume level is applied just before the voice's built in filter and effect chain is applied. For source voices the master volume level is applied after the voice's filter and effect chain is applied. Volume levels are expressed as floating-point amplitude multipliers between -2^24 and 2^24, with a maximum gain of 144.5 dB. A volume level of 1.0 means there is no attenuation or gain and 0 means silence. Negative levels can be used to invert the audio's phase.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2Voice.SetVolumeNative(System.Single,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the overall volume level for the voice.
member.param: Overall volume level to use. See Remarks for more information on volume levels.
Identifies this call as part of a deferred batch. For more information see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/ee415807(v=vs.85).aspx.
member.returns: HRESULT
member.remarks: The master volume level is applied at different times depending on the type of voice. For submix and mastering voices the volume level is applied just before the voice's built in filter and effect chain is applied. For source voices the master volume level is applied after the voice's filter and effect chain is applied. Volume levels are expressed as floating-point amplitude multipliers between -2^24 and 2^24, with a maximum gain of 144.5 dB. A volume level of 1.0 means there is no attenuation or gain and 0 means silence. Negative levels can be used to invert the audio's phase.

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2Voice.SetOutputMatrixNative(CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2Voice,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the volume level of each channel of the final output for the voice. These channels are mapped to the input channels of a specified destination voice.
member.param: Destination for which to set volume levels. If the voice sends to a single target voice then specifying null will cause SetOutputMatrix to operate on that target voice.
Confirms the output channel count of the voice. This is the number of channels that are produced by the last effect in the chain.
Confirms the input channel count of the destination voice.

Array of [SourceChannels DestinationChannels] volume levels sent to the destination voice. The level sent from source channel S to destination channel D is specified in the form levelMatrix[SourceChannels D + S]. For more details see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/microsoft.directx_sdk.ixaudio2voice.ixaudio2voice.setoutputmatrix(v=vs.85).aspx.
