member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2_7.CreateSourceVoiceNative(System.IntPtr@,System.IntPtr,CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceFlags,System.Single,CSCore.XAudio2.IXAudio2VoiceCallback,System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceSends},System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.EffectChain})
member.summary: Creates and configures a source voice. For more information see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/microsoft.directx_sdk.ixaudio2.ixaudio2.createsourcevoice(v=vs.85).aspx.
member.param: If successful, returns a pointer to the new object.

Pointer to a . The following formats are supported:
8-bit (unsigned) integer PCM
16-bit integer PCM (optimal format for XAudio2)
20-bit integer PCM (either in 24 or 32 bit containers)
24-bit integer PCM (either in 24 or 32 bit containers)
32-bit integer PCM
32-bit float PCM (preferred format after 16-bit integer)
The number of channels in a source voice must be less than or equal to . The sample rate of a source voice must be between and .
that specify the behavior of the source voice. A flag can be or a combination of one or more of the following. Possible values are , and . is not supported on Windows.
Highest allowable frequency ratio that can be set on this voice. The value for this argument must be between and .
Client-provided callback interface, . This parameter is optional and can be null.
List of structures that describe the set of destination voices for the source voice. If is NULL, the send list defaults to a single output to the first mastering voice created.
List of structures that describe an effect chain to use in the source voice. This parameter is optional and can be null.
member.returns: HRESULT

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2_7.CreateSubmixVoiceNative(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,System.Int32,CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceFlags,System.Int32,System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceSends},System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.EffectChain})
member.summary: Creates and configures a submix voice.
member.param: On success, returns a pointer to the new object.
Number of channels in the input audio data of the submix voice. The must be less than or equal to .
Sample rate of the input audio data of submix voice. This rate must be a multiple of . InputSampleRate must be between and .
Flags that specify the behavior of the submix voice. It can be or .

An arbitrary number that specifies when this voice is processed with respect to other submix voices, if the XAudio2 engine is running other submix voices. The voice is processed after all other voices that include a smaller value and before all other voices that include a larger value. Voices that include the same value are processed in any order. A submix voice cannot send to another submix voice with a lower or equal value. This prevents audio being lost due to a submix cycle.
List of structures that describe the set of destination voices for the submix voice. If is NULL, the send list will default to a single output to the first mastering voice created.
List of structures that describe an effect chain to use in the submix voice. This parameter is optional and can be null.
member.returns: HRESULT

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2_7.CreateMasteringVoiceNative(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.EffectChain},CSCore.XAudio2.AudioStreamCategory)
member.summary: Creates and configures a mastering voice.
member.param: If successful, returns a pointer to the new object.

Number of channels the mastering voice expects in its input audio. must be less than or equal to . You can set InputChannels to , which causes XAudio2 to try to detect the system speaker configuration setup.

Sample rate of the input audio data of the mastering voice. This rate must be a multiple of . must be between and . You can set InputSampleRate to , with the default being determined by the current platform.
Flags that specify the behavior of the mastering voice. Must be 0.
Identifier of the device to receive the output audio. Specifying the default value of 0 (zero) causes XAudio2 to select the global default audio device.
structure that describes an effect chain to use in the mastering voice, or NULL to use no effects.
member.returns: HRESULT

member.summary: Creates and configures a source voice. For more information see http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/microsoft.directx_sdk.ixaudio2.ixaudio2.createsourcevoice(v=vs.85).aspx.
member.param: If successful, returns a pointer to the new object.

Pointer to a . The following formats are supported:
8-bit (unsigned) integer PCM
16-bit integer PCM (optimal format for XAudio2)
20-bit integer PCM (either in 24 or 32 bit containers)
24-bit integer PCM (either in 24 or 32 bit containers)
32-bit integer PCM
32-bit float PCM (preferred format after 16-bit integer)
The number of channels in a source voice must be less than or equal to . The sample rate of a source voice must be between and .
that specify the behavior of the source voice. A flag can be or a combination of one or more of the following. Possible values are , and . is not supported on Windows.
Highest allowable frequency ratio that can be set on this voice. The value for this argument must be between and .
Client-provided callback interface, . This parameter is optional and can be null.
List of structures that describe the set of destination voices for the source voice. If is NULL, the send list defaults to a single output to the first mastering voice created.
List of structures that describe an effect chain to use in the source voice. This parameter is optional and can be null.
member.returns: HRESULT

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2_8.CreateSubmixVoiceNative(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,System.Int32,CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceFlags,System.Int32,System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.VoiceSends},System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.EffectChain})
member.summary: Creates and configures a submix voice.
member.param: On success, returns a pointer to the new object.
Number of channels in the input audio data of the submix voice. The must be less than or equal to .
Sample rate of the input audio data of submix voice. This rate must be a multiple of . InputSampleRate must be between and .
Flags that specify the behavior of the submix voice. It can be or .

An arbitrary number that specifies when this voice is processed with respect to other submix voices, if the XAudio2 engine is running other submix voices. The voice is processed after all other voices that include a smaller value and before all other voices that include a larger value. Voices that include the same value are processed in any order. A submix voice cannot send to another submix voice with a lower or equal value. This prevents audio being lost due to a submix cycle.
List of structures that describe the set of destination voices for the submix voice. If is NULL, the send list will default to a single output to the first mastering voice created.
List of structures that describe an effect chain to use in the submix voice. This parameter is optional and can be null.
member.returns: HRESULT

member.name: M:CSCore.XAudio2.XAudio2_8.CreateMasteringVoiceNative(System.IntPtr@,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Object,System.Nullable{CSCore.XAudio2.EffectChain},CSCore.XAudio2.AudioStreamCategory)
member.summary: Creates and configures a mastering voice.
member.param: If successful, returns a pointer to the new object.

Number of channels the mastering voice expects in its input audio. must be less than or equal to . You can set InputChannels to , which causes XAudio2 to try to detect the system speaker configuration setup.

Sample rate of the input audio data of the mastering voice. This rate must be a multiple of . must be between and . You can set InputSampleRate to , with the default being determined by the current platform.
Flags that specify the behavior of the mastering voice. Must be 0.
Identifier of the device to receive the output audio. Specifying the default value of NULL causes XAudio2 to select the global default audio device.
structure that describes an effect chain to use in the mastering voice, or NULL to use no effects.
The audio stream category to use for this mastering voice.
member.returns: HRESULT

member.summary: Gets the number of samples contained in one compressed block of audio data. This value is used in buffer estimation. This value is used with compressed formats that have a fixed number of samples within each block. The term "raw elements" describes the elements, an audio source uses. What type of unit an implementation of the interface uses, depends on the implementation itself. member.name: P:CSCore.WaveFormat.BytesPerSecond
member.summary: Gets the required average data transfer rate, in bytes per second. For example, 16-bit stereo at 44.1 kHz has an average data rate of 176,400 bytes per second (2 channels 2 bytes per sample per channel 44,100 samples per second).

member.name: P:CSCore.WaveFormat.BlockAlign
member.summary: Gets the block alignment, in bytes. The block alignment is the minimum atomic unit of data. For PCM data, the block alignment is the number of bytes used by a single sample, including data for both channels if the data is stereo. For example, the block alignment for 16-bit stereo PCM is 4 bytes (2 channels x 2 bytes per sample).

member.param: A object in which the found header will be stored.
A object to search.
A value specifying the seek position in at which to start searching.
member.returns: A value indicating whether or not a header was found.
member.remarks: Searching to the end of the file can be very, very slow especially for corrupt or non-MPEG files. It is recommended to use instead.

member.name: T:TagLib.Aac.File
member.summary: This class extends to provide tagging and properties support for ADTS AAC audio files.
member.remarks: A and will be added automatically to any file that doesn't contain one. This change does not effect the file until it is saved and can be reversed using the following method: file.RemoveTags (file.TagTypes & ~file.TagTypesOnDisk);

member.name: M:TagLib.Aac.File.GetTag(TagLib.TagTypes,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a tag of a specified type from the current instance, optionally creating a new tag if possible.
member.param: A value indicating the type of tag to read.
A value specifying whether or not to try and create the tag if one is not found.
member.returns: A object containing the tag that was found in or added to the current instance. If no matching tag was found and none was created, is returned.
member.remarks: If a is added to the current instance, it will be placed at the start of the file. On the other hand, will be added to the end of the file. All other tag types will be ignored.

member.name: M:TagLib.Aac.File.ReadStart(System.Int64,TagLib.ReadStyle)
member.summary: Reads format specific information at the start of the file.
member.param: A value containing the seek position at which the tags end and the media data begins.
A value specifying at what level of accuracy to read the media properties, or to ignore the properties.
member.remarks: This method only searches for an audio header in the first 16384 bytes of code to avoid searching forever in corrupt files.

member.summary: Reads format specific information at the end of the file.
member.param: A value containing the seek position at which the media data ends and the tags begin.
A value specifying at what level of accuracy to read the media properties, or to ignore the properties.

A value containing the seek position at which the media data ends and the tags begin.
A value specifying at what level of accuracy to read the media properties, or to ignore the properties.
member.returns: A object describing the media properties of the file represented by the current instance.

member.name: T:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader
member.summary: This struct implements to provide support for reading Apple's AIFF stream properties.

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.channels
member.summary: Contains the number of channels.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (9,10). 1 is monophonic, 2 is stereo, 4 means 4 channels, etc.. any number of audio channels may be represented

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.total_frames
member.summary: Contains the number of sample frames in the Sound Data chunk.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (11-14).

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.bits_per_sample
member.summary: Contains the number of bits per sample.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (15,16). It can be any number from 1 to 32.

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.sample_rate
member.summary: Contains the sample rate.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (17-26). the sample rate at which the sound is to be played back, in sample frames per second

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.stream_length
member.summary: Contains the length of the audio stream.
member.remarks: This value is provided by the constructor.

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.Size
member.summary: The size of an AIFF Common chunk

member.name: F:TagLib.Aiff.StreamHeader.FileIdentifier
member.summary: The identifier used to recognize a AIFF file. Altough an AIFF file start with "FORM2, we're interested in the Common chunk only, which contains the properties we need.
member.value: "COMM"

member.name: T:TagLib.Ape.CompressionLevel
member.summary: Indicates the compression level used when encoding a Monkey's Audio APE file.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.CompressionLevel.None
member.summary: The audio is not compressed.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.CompressionLevel.Fast
member.summary: The audio is mildly compressed.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.CompressionLevel.Normal
member.summary: The audio is compressed at a normal level.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.CompressionLevel.High
member.summary: The audio is highly compressed.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.CompressionLevel.ExtraHigh
member.summary: The audio is extremely highly compressed.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.CompressionLevel.Insane
member.summary: The audio is compressed to an insane level.

member.name: T:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader
member.summary: This struct implements to provide support for reading Monkey's Audio APE stream properties.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.version
member.summary: Contains the APE version.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (4,5) of the file and is 1000 times the actual version number, so 3810 indicates version 3.81.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.compression_level
member.summary: Contains the compression level.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (51,52).

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.blocks_per_frame
member.summary: Contains the number of audio blocks in one frame.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (55-58).

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.final_frame_blocks
member.summary: Contains the number of audio blocks in the final frame.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (59-62).

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.total_frames
member.summary: Contains the total number of frames.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (63-66).

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.bits_per_sample
member.summary: Contains the number of bits per sample.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (67,68) and is typically 16.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.channels
member.summary: Contains the number of channels.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (69,70) and is typically 1 or 2.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.sample_rate
member.summary: Contains the sample rate.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (71-74) and is typically 44100.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.stream_length
member.summary: Contains the length of the audio stream.
member.remarks: This value is provided by the constructor.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.Size
member.summary: The size of a Monkey Audio header.

member.name: F:TagLib.Ape.StreamHeader.FileIdentifier
member.summary: The identifier used to recognize a WavPack file.
member.value: "MAC "

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.TitleSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names of the Title of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the Title of the media described by the current instance, or null if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "TitleSort" item.

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.Subtitle
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description, one-liner. It represents the tagline of the Video/music.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field gives a nice/short precision to the title, which is typically below the title on the front cover of a media. For example, for "Back to the future", this would be "It's About Time".

member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "Subtitle" item.

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description of the media. For a music, this could be the comment that the artist made of its artwork. For a video, this should be a short summary of the story/plot, but a spoiler. This should give the impression of what to expect in the media.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This is especially relevant for a movie. For example, for "Back to the Future 2", this could be "After visiting 2015, Marty McFly must repeat his visit to 1955 to prevent disastrous changes to 1985...without interfering with his first trip".

member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "Description" item.

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.Performers
member.summary: Gets and sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "Artist" item.

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.PerformersSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names of the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A array containing the sort names for the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance, or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "ArtistSort" field. http://musicbrainz.org/doc/PicardTagMapping

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.PerformersRole
member.summary: Gets and sets the Charaters for a video media, or instruments played for music media. This should match the array (for each person correspond one/more role). Several roles for the same artist/actor can be made up with semicolons. For example, "Marty McFly; Marty McFly Jr.; Marlene McFly".

remarks.para: This is typically usefull for movies, although the instrument played by each artist in a music may be of relevance.
It is highly important to match each role to the performers. This means that a role may be to keep the match between a Performers[i] and PerformersRole[i].

member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "TMCL" Text Information Frame: The 'Musician credits list' is intended as a mapping between instruments and the musician that played it.Every odd field is an instrument and every even is an artist or a comma delimited list of artists.
This property is implemented using the "PerformersRole" field.

member.value: A object containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseType for the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "MUSICBRAINZ_ALBUMTYPE" item. http://musicbrainz.org/doc/PicardTagMapping

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.MusicBrainzReleaseCountry
member.summary: Gets and sets the MusicBrainz ReleaseCountry of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the MusicBrainz ReleaseCountry for the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "RELEASECOUNTRY" item. http://musicbrainz.org/doc/PicardTagMapping

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.ReplayGainTrackGain
member.summary: Gets and sets the ReplayGain track gain in dB.
member.value: A value in dB for the track gain as per the ReplayGain specification.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "REPLAYGAIN_TRACK_GAIN" field. Set the value to double.NaN to clear the field.

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.ReplayGainTrackPeak
member.summary: Gets and sets the ReplayGain track peak sample.
member.value: A value for the track peak as per the ReplayGain specification.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "REPLAYGAIN_TRACK_PEAK" field. Set the value to double.NaN to clear the field.

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.ReplayGainAlbumGain
member.summary: Gets and sets the ReplayGain album gain in dB.
member.value: A value in dB for the album gain as per the ReplayGain specification.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "REPLAYGAIN_ALBUM_GAIN" field. Set the value to double.NaN to clear the field.

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.ReplayGainAlbumPeak
member.summary: Gets and sets the ReplayGain album peak sample.
member.value: A value for the album peak as per the ReplayGain specification.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "REPLAYGAIN_ALBUM_PEAK" field. Set the value to double.NaN to clear the field.

member.name: P:TagLib.Ape.Tag.Pictures
member.summary: Gets and sets a collection of pictures associated with the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing a collection of pictures associated with the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if none are present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "Cover Art" items and supports only one picture per type.

member.summary: Gets whether or not the current instance is empty.
member.value: if the current instance does not any values. Otherwise .

member.summary: Clears the values stored in the current instance.

member.summary: Copies the values from the current instance to another , optionally overwriting existing values.

A specifying whether or not to copy values over existing one.

remarks.para: If is of type a complete copy of all values will be performed. Otherwise, only standard values will be copied.

member.summary: Gets the tag types contained in the current instance.

member.name: P:TagLib.Asf.Tag.Title
member.summary: Gets and sets the title for the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the title for the media described by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the title stored in the ASF Content Description Object.

member.name: P:TagLib.Asf.Tag.Subtitle
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description, one-liner. It represents the tagline of the Video/music.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field gives a nice/short precision to the title, which is typically below the title on the front cover of a media. For example, for "Back to the future", this would be "It's About Time".

member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "WM/SubTitle" field. https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd757997(v=vs.85).aspx

member.name: P:TagLib.Asf.Tag.TitleSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names for the Track Title of the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort name of the Track Title of the media described by the current instance or null if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "WM/TitleSortOrder" field. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa386866(VS.85).aspx

member.name: P:TagLib.Asf.Tag.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description of the media. For a music, this could be the comment that the artist made of its artwork. For a video, this should be a short summary of the story/plot, but a spoiler. This should give the impression of what to expect in the media.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the description stored in the ASF Content Description Object.

member.name: P:TagLib.Asf.Tag.Performers
member.summary: Gets and sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the author stored in the ASF Content Description Object.

member.name: P:TagLib.Asf.Tag.PerformersSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names of the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance, or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "WM/ArtistSortOrder" field. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa386866(VS.85).aspx

member.name: P:TagLib.Asf.Tag.AlbumArtists
member.summary: Gets and sets the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "WM/AlbumArtist" and "AlbumArtist" Content Descriptors.

member.name: P:TagLib.Asf.Tag.AlbumArtistsSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names for the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "WM/AlbumArtistSortOrder" field. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/aa386866(VS.85).aspx

member.name: P:TagLib.Asf.Tag.Composers
member.summary: Gets and sets the composers of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the composers of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "WM/Composer" and "Composer" Content Descriptors.

member.name: P:TagLib.Asf.Tag.Album
member.summary: Gets and sets the album of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the album of the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "WM/AlbumTitle" and "Album" Content Descriptors.

member.name: P:TagLib.ByteVector.UseBrokenLatin1Behavior
member.summary: Gets and sets whether or not to use a broken behavior for Latin-1 strings, common to ID3v1 and ID3v2 tags.
member.value: if the broken behavior is to be used. Otherwise, .

remarks.para: Many media players and taggers incorrectly treat Latin-1 fields as "default encoding" fields. As such, a tag may end up with Windows-1250 encoded text. While this problem would be apparent when moving a file from one computer to another, it would not be apparent on the original machine. By setting this property to , your program will behave like Windows Media Player and others, who read tags with this broken behavior.
Please note that TagLib# stores tag data in Unicode formats at every possible instance to avoid these problems in tags it has written.

member.name: P:TagLib.CombinedTag.Title
member.summary: Gets and sets the title for the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the title for the media described by the current instance or if no value is present.

remarks.para: When getting the value, the child tags are looped through in order and the first non- value is returned.
When setting the value, it is stored in each child tag.

member.name: P:TagLib.CombinedTag.Subtitle
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description, one-liner. It represents the tagline of the Video/music.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field gives a nice/short precision to the title, which is typically below the title on the front cover of a media. For example, for "Back to the future", this would be "It's About Time".

member.name: P:TagLib.CombinedTag.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description of the media. For a music, this could be the comment that the artist made of its artwork. For a video, this should be a short summary of the story/plot, but a spoiler. This should give the impression of what to expect in the media.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This is especially relevant for a movie. For example, for "Back to the Future 2", this could be "After visiting 2015, Marty McFly must repeat his visit to 1955 to prevent disastrous changes to 1985...without interfering with his first trip".

member.name: P:TagLib.CombinedTag.Performers
member.summary: Gets and sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: When getting the value, the child tags are looped through in order and the first non- and non-empty value is returned.
When setting the value, it is stored in each child tag.

member.name: P:TagLib.CombinedTag.PerformersSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names of the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance, or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: When getting the value, the child tags are looped through in order and the first non- and non-empty value is returned.
When setting the value, it is stored in each child tag.

member.name: P:TagLib.CombinedTag.PerformersRole
member.summary: Gets and sets the Charaters for a video media, or instruments played for music media. This should match the array (for each person correspond one/more role). Several roles for the same artist/actor can be made up with semicolons. For example, "Marty McFly; Marty McFly Jr.; Marlene McFly".

remarks.para: This is typically usefull for movies, although the instrument played by each artist in a music may be of relevance.
It is highly important to match each role to the performers. This means that a role may be to keep the match between a Performers[i] and PerformersRole[i].

member.name: P:TagLib.CombinedTag.AlbumArtistsSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names for the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: When getting the value, the child tags are looped through in order and the first non- and non-empty value is returned.
When setting the value, it is stored in each child tag.

member.name: T:TagLib.CorruptFileException
member.summary: This class extends and is used to indicate that a file or tag is corrupt.
member.remarks: This exception will be thrown if invalid data interferes with the reading of the file or tag. One common example is in the (legal) downloading of media files with BitTorrent, in which case large portions of the file will contain zeroed bytes.

example.para: Catching an exception when creating a .
example.code:
Imports System Imports TagLib
Public Class ExceptionTest Public Shared Sub Main () Try file As File = File.Create ("partial.mp3") ' Partial download. Catch e As CorruptFileException Console.WriteLine ("That file is corrupt: {0}", e.ToString ()); End Try End Sub End Class

member.name: T:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader
member.summary: This struct implements to provide support for reading DSF stream properties.

member.name: F:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader.version
member.summary: Contains the version.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (12-15). Currently only value of 1 is valid.

member.name: F:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader.format_id
member.summary: The Format Id.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (16-19). 0: DSD Raw

member.name: F:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader.channel_type
member.summary: The Channel Type.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (20-23). 1: mono 2:stereo 3:3 channels 4: quad 5: 4 channels 6: 5 channels 7: 5.1 channels

member.name: F:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader.channels
member.summary: Contains the number of channels.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (24-27). 1 is monophonic, 2 is stereo, 4 means 4 channels, etc.. up to 6 channels may be represented

member.name: F:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader.sample_rate
member.summary: Contains the sample rate.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (28-31). the sample rate at which the sound is to be played back, in Hz: 2822400, 5644800

member.name: F:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader.bits_per_sample
member.summary: Contains the number of bits per sample.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (32-35). It can be any number from 1 to 8.

member.name: F:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader.sample_count
member.summary: Contains the number of sample frames per channel.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (36-43).

member.name: F:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader.channel_blksize
member.summary: Contains the Block size per channel.
member.remarks: This value is stored in bytes (44-47). Always: 4096

member.name: F:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader.stream_length
member.summary: Contains the length of the audio stream.
member.remarks: This value is provided by the constructor.

member.name: F:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader.Size
member.summary: The size of an DSF Format chunk

member.name: F:TagLib.Dsf.StreamHeader.FileIdentifier
member.summary: The identifier used to recognize a DSF file. Altough an DSF file start with "DSD ", we're interested in the Format chunk only, which contains the properties we need.
member.value: "fmt "

member.name: T:TagLib.File
member.summary: This abstract class provides a basic framework for reading from and writing to a file, as well as accessing basic tagging and media properties.

remarks.para: This class is agnostic to all specific media types. Its child classes, on the other hand, support the the intricacies of different media and tagging formats. For example, supports the MPEG-4 specificication and Apple's tagging format.

Each file type can be created using its format specific constructors, ie. , but the preferred method is to use or one of its variants, as it automatically detects the appropriate class from the file extension or provided mime-type.

member.name: T:TagLib.File.AccessMode
member.summary: Specifies the type of file access operations currently permitted on an instance of .

member.name: F:TagLib.File.AccessMode.Read
member.summary: Read operations can be performed.

member.name: F:TagLib.File.AccessMode.Write
member.summary: Read and write operations can be performed.

member.name: F:TagLib.File.AccessMode.Closed
member.summary: The file is closed for both read and write operations.

member.name: T:TagLib.File.FileTypeResolver
member.summary: This delegate is used for intervening in by resolving the file type before any standard resolution operations.
member.param: A object representing the file to be read.
A object containing the mime-type of the file.
A value specifying how to read media properties from the file.
member.returns: A new instance of or if the resolver could not match it.

remarks.para: A is one way of altering the behavior of .
When is called, the registered resolvers are invoked in the reverse order in which they were registered. The resolver may then perform any operations necessary, including other type-finding methods.
If the resolver returns a new , it will instantly be returned, by . If it returns , will continue to process. If the resolver throws an exception it will be uncaught.
To register a resolver, use .

member.name: M:TagLib.File.GetTag(TagLib.TagTypes,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets a tag of a specified type from the current instance, optionally creating a new tag if possible.
member.param: A value indicating the type of tag to read.
A value specifying whether or not to try and create the tag if one is not found.
member.returns: A object containing the tag that was found in or added to the current instance. If no matching tag was found and none was created, is returned.

remarks.para: Passing to does not guarantee the tag will be created. For example, trying to create an ID3v2 tag on an OGG Vorbis file will always fail.
It is safe to assume that if is not returned, the returned tag can be cast to the appropriate type.

example.para: The following example sets the mood of a file to several tag types.

member.name: M:TagLib.File.GetTag(TagLib.TagTypes)
member.summary: Gets a tag of a specified type from the current instance.
member.param: A value indicating the type of tag to read.
member.returns: A object containing the tag that was found in the current instance. If no matching tag was found, is returned.

remarks.para: This class merely accesses the tag if it exists. provides the option of adding the tag to the current instance if it does not exist.
It is safe to assume that if is not returned, the returned tag can be cast to the appropriate type.

example.para: The following example reads the mood of a file from several tag types.

member.name: T:TagLib.File.IFileAbstraction
member.summary: This interface provides abstracted access to a file. It premits access to non-standard file systems and data retrieval methods.

remarks.para: To use a custom abstraction, use instead of when creating files.

example.para: The following example uses Gnome VFS to open a file and read its title.

member.name: P:TagLib.File.IFileAbstraction.Name
member.summary: Gets the name or identifier used by the implementation.
member.value: A object containing the name or identifier used by the implementation.
member.remarks: This value would typically represent a path or URL to be used when identifying the file in the file system, but it could be any value as appropriate for the implementation.

member.name: P:TagLib.File.IFileAbstraction.ReadStream
member.summary: Gets a readable, seekable stream for the file referenced by the current instance.
member.value: A object to be used when reading a file.
member.remarks: This property is typically used when creating constructing an instance of . Upon completion of the constructor, will be called to close the stream. If the stream is to be reused after this point, should be implemented in a way to keep it open.

member.name: P:TagLib.File.IFileAbstraction.WriteStream
member.summary: Gets a writable, seekable stream for the file referenced by the current instance.
member.value: A object to be used when writing to a file.
member.remarks: This property is typically used when saving a file with . Upon completion of the method, will be called to close the stream. If the stream is to be reused after this point, should be implemented in a way to keep it open.

member.name: M:TagLib.File.IFileAbstraction.CloseStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Closes a stream originating from the current instance.
member.param: A object originating from the current instance.
member.remarks: If the stream is to be used outside of the scope, of TagLib#, this method should perform no action. For example, a stream that was created outside of the current instance, or a stream that will subsequently be used to play the file.

member.name: T:TagLib.FileTypes
member.summary: This static class provides a mechanism for registering file classes and mime-types, to be used when constructing a class via .

member.name: F:TagLib.FileTypes.static_file_types
member.summary: Contains a static array of file types contained in the TagLib# assembly.
member.remarks: A static Type array is used instead of getting types by reflecting the executing assembly as Assembly.GetTypes is very inefficient and leaks every type instance under Mono. Not reflecting taglib-sharp.dll saves about 120KB of heap.

member.summary: Application Extension Identifier for an XMP Block

member.summary: Application Authentication Extension Code for an XMP Block

member.name: F:TagLib.Gif.File.XMP_MAGIC_TRAILER
member.summary: The Magic Trailer for XMP Data
member.remarks: The storage of XMP data in GIF does not follow the GIF specification. According to the specification, extension data is stored in so-called sub-blocks, which start with a length byte which specifies the number of data bytes contained in the sub block. So a block can at most contain 256 data bytes. After a sub-block, the next sub-block begins. The sequence ends, when a sub-block starts with 0. So readers, which are not aware of the XMP data not following this scheme, will get confused by the XMP data. To fix this, this trailer is added to the end. It has a length of 258 bytes, so that it is ensured that a reader which tries to skip the XMP data reads one of this bytes as length of a sub-block. But, each byte points with its length to the last one. Therefoe, independent of the byte, the reader reads as sub-block length, it is redirected to the last byte of the trailer and therfore to the end of the XMP data.

member.summary: Skips the color table if there is one
member.param: A with the packed data which is contained Logical Screen Descriptor or in the Image Descriptor.
member.remarks: The data contained in the packed data is different for the Logical Screen Descriptor and for the Image Descriptor. But fortunately, the bits which are used do identifying the exitstance and the size of the color table are at the same position.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Title
member.summary: Gets and sets the title for the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the title for the media described by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 30 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored. This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Performers
member.summary: Gets and sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 30 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored, minus a byte for each additionial performer (i.e. two performers will only have 29 bytes and three performers will only have 28 bytes).This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Album
member.summary: Gets and sets the album of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the album of the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 30 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored. This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Comment
member.summary: Gets and sets a user comment on the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing user comments on the media represented by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: When stored on disk, only the first 28 bytes of the Latin-1 encoded value will be stored. This may result in lost data.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Genres
member.summary: Gets and sets the genres of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the genres of the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: Only first genre will be stored and only if it is an exact match for a value appearing in . All other values will result in the property being cleared.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Year
member.summary: Gets and sets the year that the media represented by the current instance was recorded.
member.value: A containing the year that the media represented by the current instance was created or zero if no value is present.
member.remarks: Only values between 1 and 9999 will be stored, all other values will result in the property being zeroed.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v1.Tag.Track
member.summary: Gets and sets the position of the media represented by the current instance in its containing album.
member.value: A containing the position of the media represented by the current instance in its containing album or zero if not specified.
member.remarks: Only values between 1 and 255 will be stored, all other values will result in the property being zeroed.

A value specifying whether the entire tag has already been unsynchronized.

member.summary: Adds a curstom frame creator to try before using standard frame creation methods.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.AttachmentFrame
member.summary: This class extends , implementing support for ID3v2 Attached Picture (APIC), ID3v2 General Encapsulated Object (GEOB) and Frames.

remarks.para: A is used for storing any file (picture or other types) that complement. This is typically (but not only limited to) the album cover, the physical medium, leaflets, file icons or other files and object data.
Additionally, provides a generic way or getting and setting pictures/files which is preferable to format specific code.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.CommentsFrame
member.summary: This class extends , implementing support for ID3v2 Comments (COMM) Frames.

remarks.para: A should be used for storing user readable comments on the media file.

When reading comments from a file, should be used as it gracefully falls back to comments that you, as a developer, may not be expecting. When writing comments, however, it is best to use as it forces it to be written in the exact version you are expecting.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.MusicCdIdentifierFrame
member.summary: This class extends , implementing support for ID3v2 Music CD Identifier (MCDI) Frames.
member.remarks: Music CD Identifier Frames should contain the table of contents data as stored on the physical CD. It is primarily used for track information lookup by through web sources like CDDB.

example.para: Reading the music CD identifier from a tag.
example.code:
Imports TagLib Imports TagLib.Id3v2
Public Shared Class LookupUtil Public Shared Sub GetCdIdentifier (filename As String) As TagLib.ByteVector Dim file As File = File.Create (filename, ReadStyle.None) Dim tag As Id3v2.Tag = file.GetTag (TagTypes.Id3v2, False) If tag Is Nothing Return New ByteVector ()
Dim frame As MusicCdIdentifierFrame = MusicCdIdentifierFrame.Get (tag, False) If frame Is Nothing Return New ByteVector ()
Return frame.Data End Sub End Class

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.PlayCountFrame
member.summary: This class extends , implementing support for ID3v2 Play Count (PCNT) Frames.

example.para: Getting and incrementing the play count of a file.
example.code:
Imports TagLib Imports TagLib.Id3v2
Public Shared Class TrackUtil Public Shared Sub GetPlayCount (filename As String) As Integer Dim file As File = File.Create (filename, ReadStyle.None) Dim tag As Id3v2.Tag = file.GetTag (TagTypes.Id3v2, False) If tag Is Nothing Then Return 0
Dim frame As PlayCountFrame = PlayCountFrame.Get (tag, False) If frame Is Nothing Then Return 0
Return frame.PlayCount End Sub
Public Shared Sub IncrementPlayCount (filename As String) Dim file As File = File.Create (filename, ReadStyle.None) Dim tag As Id3v2.Tag = file.GetTag (TagTypes.Id3v2, True) If tag Is Nothing Then Exit Sub
PlayCountFrame.Get (tag, True).PlayCount += 1 file.Save () End Sub End Class

import TagLib import TagLib.Id3v2
public static class TrackUtil: static def GetPlayCount (filename as string) as int: file As File = File.Create (filename, ReadStyle.None) tag as Id3v2.Tag = file.GetTag (TagTypes.Id3v2, false) if tag == null: return 0
frame as PlayCountFrame = PlayCountFrame.Get (tag, false) if frame == null: return 0
return frame.PlayCount
static def IncrementPlayCount (filename as string): file as File = File.Create (filename, ReadStyle.None) tag as Id3v2.Tag = file.GetTag (TagTypes.Id3v2, True) if tag == null: return
PlayCountFrame.Get (tag, true).PlayCount ++ file.Save ()

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.PrivateFrame
member.summary: This class extends , implementing support for ID3v2 Private (PRIV) Frames.

remarks.para: A should be used for storing values specific to the application that cannot or should not be stored in another frame type.

example.para: Serializing a database entry and storing it in a private field.
example.code:
Imports System Imports System.IO Imports System.Runtime.Serialization Imports System.Text Imports System.Xml.Serialization Imports TagLib.Id3v2
Public Shared Class DbUtil Public Shared Sub StoreDatabaseEntry (tag As Tag, dbEntry As ISerializable) Dim data As New StringWriter (New StringBuilder ()) Dim serializer As New XmlSerializer (dbEntry.GetType ()) serializer.Serialize (data, dbEntry) Dim frame As PrivateFrame = PrivateFrame.Get (tag, "org.MyProgram.DatabaseEntry", True) frame.PrivateData = Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes (data.ToString ()) End Sub
Public Shared Sub GetDatabaseEntry (tag As Tag, type As Type) Dim frame As PrivateFrame = PrivateFrame.Get (tag, "org.MyProgram.DatabaseEntry", False) If frame Is Nothing Then Return Nothing
Dim serializer As XmlSerializer = New XmlSerializer (type) Return serializer.Deserialize (New MemoryStream (frame.PrivateData)) End Sub End Class

import System import System.IO import System.Runtime.Serialization import System.Text import System.Xml.Serialization import TagLib.Id3v2
public static class DbUtil: static def StoreDatabaseEntry (tag as Tag, dbEntry as ISerializable): data as StringWriter = StringWriter (StringBuilder ()) serializer as XmlSerializer = XmlSerializer (dbEntry.GetType ()) serializer.Serialize (data, dbEntry) frame as PrivateFrame = PrivateFrame.Get (tag, "org.MyProgram.DatabaseEntry", true) frame.PrivateData = Encoding.UTF8.GetBytes (data.ToString ())
static def GetDatabaseEntry (tag As Tag, type As Type): frame as PrivateFrame = PrivateFrame.Get (tag, "org.MyProgram.DatabaseEntry", false) if frame == null: return null
serializer as XmlSerializer = XmlSerializer (type) return serializer.Deserialize (MemoryStream (frame.PrivateData))

item.term: The first frame with a matching description, language, and type.
The first frame with a matching description and language.
The first frame with a matching language.
The first frame with a matching description.
The first frame with a matching type.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.TextInformationFrame
member.summary: This class extends to provide support ID3v2 Text Information Frames (Section 4.2), covering "T000" to "TZZZ", excluding "TXXX".

remarks.para: Text Information Frames contain the most commonly used values in tagging, including the artist, the track name, and just about any value that can be expressed as text.
The following table contains types and descriptions as found in the ID3 2.4.0 native frames specification. (Copyright (C) Martin Nilsson 2000.)

item.description: The 'Content group description' frame is used if the sound belongs to a larger category of sounds/music. For example, classical music is often sorted in different musical sections (e.g. "Piano Concerto", "Weather - Hurricane").
The 'Title/Songname/Content description' frame is the actual name of the piece (e.g. "Adagio", "Hurricane Donna").
The 'Subtitle/Description refinement' frame is used for information directly related to the contents title (e.g. "Op. 16" or "Performed live at Wembley").
The 'Album/Movie/Show title' frame is intended for the title of the recording (or source of sound) from which the audio in the file is taken.

The 'Original album/movie/show title' frame is intended for the title of the original recording (or source of sound), if for example the music in the file should be a cover of a previously released song.

The 'Track number/Position in set' frame is a numeric string containing the order number of the audio-file on its original recording. This MAY be extended with a "/" character and a numeric string containing the total number of tracks/elements on the original recording. E.g. "4/9".

The 'Part of a set' frame is a numeric string that describes which part of a set the audio came from. This frame is used if the source described in the "TALB" frame is divided into several mediums, e.g. a double CD. The value MAY be extended with a "/" character and a numeric string containing the total number of parts in the set. E.g. "1/2".
The 'Set subtitle' frame is intended for the subtitle of the part of a set this track belongs to.
The 'ISRC' frame should contain the International Standard Recording Code [ISRC] (12 characters).
The 'Lead artist/Lead performer/Soloist/Performing group' is used for the main artist.
The 'Band/Orchestra/Accompaniment' frame is used for additional information about the performers in the recording.
The 'Conductor' frame is used for the name of the conductor.
The 'Interpreted, remixed, or otherwise modified by' frame contains more information about the people behind a remix and similar interpretations of another existing piece.
The 'Original artist/performer' frame is intended for the performer of the original recording, if for example the music in the file should be a cover of a previously released song.
The 'Lyricist/Text writer' frame is intended for the writer of the text or lyrics in the recording.
The 'Original lyricist/text writer' frame is intended for the text writer of the original recording, if for example the music in the file should be a cover of a previously released song.
The 'Composer' frame is intended for the name of the composer.

The 'Musician credits list' is intended as a mapping between instruments and the musician that played it. Every odd field is an instrument and every even is an artist or a comma delimited list of artists.
The 'Involved people list' is very similar to the musician credits list, but maps between functions, like producer, and names.
The 'Encoded by' frame contains the name of the person or organisation that encoded the audio file. This field may contain a copyright message, if the audio file also is copyrighted by the encoder.
The 'BPM' frame contains the number of beats per minute in the main part of the audio. The BPM is an integer and represented as a numerical string.
The 'Length' frame contains the length of the audio file in milliseconds, represented as a numeric string.

The 'Initial key' frame contains the musical key in which the sound starts. It is represented as a string with a maximum length of three characters. The ground keys are represented with "A","B","C","D","E", "F" and "G" and halfkeys represented with "b" and "#". Minor is represented as "m", e.g. "Dbm". Off key is represented with an "o" only.

The 'Language' frame should contain the languages of the text or lyrics spoken or sung in the audio. The language is represented with three characters according to ISO-639-2. If more than one language is used in the text their language codes should follow according to the amount of their usage.

The 'Content type', which ID3v1 was stored as a one byte numeric value only, is now a string. You may use one or several of the ID3v1 types as numerical strings, or, since the category list would be impossible to maintain with accurate and up to date categories, define your own.
The 'File type' frame indicates which type of audio this tag defines. (See the specification for more details.)
The 'Media type' frame describes from which media the sound originated. (See the specification for more details.)
The 'Mood' frame is intended to reflect the mood of the audio with a few keywords, e.g. "Romantic" or "Sad".

The 'Copyright message' frame, in which the string must begin with a year and a space character (making five characters), is intended for the copyright holder of the original sound, not the audio file itself. The absence of this frame means only that the copyright information is unavailable or has been removed, and must not be interpreted to mean that the audio is public domain. Every time this field is displayed the field must be preceded with "Copyright " (C) " ", where (C) is one character showing a C in a circle.

The 'Produced notice' frame, in which the string must begin with a year and a space character (making five characters), is intended for the production copyright holder of the original sound, not the audio file itself. The absence of this frame means only that the production copyright information is unavailable or has been removed, and must not be interpreted to mean that the audio is public domain. Every time this field is displayed the field must be preceded with "Produced " (P) " ", where (P) is one character showing a P in a circle.
The 'Publisher' frame simply contains the name of the label or publisher.
The 'File owner/licensee' frame contains the name of the owner or licensee of the file and it's contents.
The 'Internet radio station name' frame contains the name of the internet radio station from which the audio is streamed.
The 'Internet radio station owner' frame contains the name of the owner of the internet radio station from which the audio is streamed.
The 'Original filename' frame contains the preferred filename for the file, since some media doesn't allow the desired length of the filename. The filename is case sensitive and includes its suffix.

The 'Playlist delay' defines the numbers of milliseconds of silence that should be inserted before this audio. The value zero indicates that this is a part of a multifile audio track that should be played continuously.
The 'Encoding time' frame contains a timestamp describing when the audio was encoded. Timestamp format is described in the ID3v2 structure document.
The 'Original release time' frame contains a timestamp describing when the original recording of the audio was released. Timestamp format is described in the ID3v2 structure document.
The 'Recording time' frame contains a timestamp describing when the audio was recorded. Timestamp format is described in the ID3v2 structure document.
The 'Release time' frame contains a timestamp describing when the audio was first released. Timestamp format is described in the ID3v2 structure document.
The 'Tagging time' frame contains a timestamp describing then the audio was tagged. Timestamp format is described in the ID3v2 structure document.

The 'Software/Hardware and settings used for encoding' frame includes the used audio encoder and its settings when the file was encoded. Hardware refers to hardware encoders, not the computer on which a program was run.

The 'Album sort order' frame defines a string which should be used instead of the album name (TALB) for sorting purposes. E.g. an album named "A Soundtrack" might preferably be sorted as "Soundtrack".
The 'Performer sort order' frame defines a string which should be used instead of the performer (TPE2) for sorting purposes.
The 'Title sort order' frame defines a string which should be used instead of the title (TIT2) for sorting purposes.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.UrlLinkFrame
member.summary: This class extends to provide support ID3v2 Url Link Frames (Section 4.3.1), covering "W000" to "WZZZ", excluding "WXXX".

remarks.para: With these frames dynamic data such as webpages with touring information, price information or plain ordinary news can be added to the tag. There may only be one URL [URL] link frame of its kind in an tag, except when stated otherwise in the frame description. If the text string is followed by a string termination, all the following information should be ignored and not be displayed.
The following table contains types and descriptions as found in the ID3 2.4.0 native frames specification. (Copyright (C) Martin Nilsson 2000.)

item.description: The 'Commercial information' frame is a URL pointing at a webpage with information such as where the album can be bought. There may be more than one "WCOM" frame in a tag, but not with the same content.
The 'Copyright/Legal information' frame is a URL pointing at a webpage where the terms of use and ownership of the file is described.
The 'Official audio file webpage' frame is a URL pointing at a file specific webpage.

The 'Official artist/performer webpage' frame is a URL pointing at the artists official webpage. There may be more than one "WOAR" frame in a tag if the audio contains more than one performer, but not with the same content.
The 'Official audio source webpage' frame is a URL pointing at the official webpage for the source of the audio file, e.g. a movie.
The 'Official Internet radio station homepage' contains a URL pointing at the homepage of the internet radio station.
The 'Payment' frame is a URL pointing at a webpage that will handle the process of paying for this file.
The 'Publishers official webpage' frame is a URL pointing at the official webpage for the publisher.

member.name: T:TagLib.Id3v2.FrameType
member.summary: provides references to different frame types used by the library.

remarks.para: This class is used to severely reduce the number of times these types are created in , greatly improving the speed at which warm files are read. It is, however, not necessary for external users to use this class. While the library may use GetTextAsString (FrameType.TIT2); an external user could use tag.GetTextAsString ("TIT2"); with the same result.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v2.Tag.Title
member.summary: Gets and sets the title for the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing the title for the media described by the current instance or if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "TIT2" Text Information Frame.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v2.Tag.TitleSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names of the Title of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the Title of the media described by the current instance, or null if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "TSOT" Text Information Frame.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v2.Tag.Subtitle
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description, one-liner. It represents the tagline of the Video/music.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This field gives a nice/short precision to the title, which is typically below the title on the front cover of a media. For example, for "Back to the future", this would be "It's About Time".

member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "TIT3" Text Information Frame.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v2.Tag.Description
member.summary: Gets and sets a short description of the media. For a music, this could be the comment that the artist made of its artwork. For a video, this should be a short summary of the story/plot, but a spoiler. This should give the impression of what to expect in the media.
member.value: A containing the subtitle the media represented by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.

remarks.para: This is especially relevant for a movie. For example, for "Back to the Future 2", this could be "After visiting 2015, Marty McFly must repeat his visit to 1955 to prevent disastrous changes to 1985...without interfering with his first trip".

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v2.Tag.Performers
member.summary: Gets and sets the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "TPE1" Text Information Frame.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v2.Tag.PerformersSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names of the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance, or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "TSOP" Text Information Frame. http://www.id3.org/id3v2.4.0-frames

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v2.Tag.PerformersRole
member.summary: Gets and sets the Charaters for a video media, or instruments played for music media. This should match the array (for each person correspond one/more role). Several roles for the same artist/actor can be made up with semicolons. For example, "Marty McFly; Marty McFly Jr.; Marlene McFly".

remarks.para: This is typically usefull for movies, although the instrument played by each artist in a music may be of relevance.
It is highly important to match each role to the performers. This means that a role may be to keep the match between a Performers[i] and PerformersRole[i].

member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "TMCL" Text Information Frame: The 'Musician credits list' is intended as a mapping between instruments and the musician that played it.Every odd field is an instrument and every even is an artist or a comma delimited list of artists.

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v2.Tag.AlbumArtistsSort
member.summary: Gets and sets the sort names of the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the sort names for the performers or artists who performed in the media described by the current instance, or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "TSO2" Text Information Frame. http://www.id3.org/iTunes

member.name: P:TagLib.Id3v2.Tag.AlbumArtists
member.summary: Gets and sets the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the band or artist who is credited in the creation of the entire album or collection containing the media described by the current instance or an empty array if no value is present.
member.remarks: This property is implemented using the "TPE2" Text Information Frame.

member.name: T:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType
member.summary: An enum to represent the manufactor of the makernote The information of the makernote types is from: http://exiv2.org/makernote.html

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType.Unknown
member.summary: The manufactor could not be determined

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType.Canon
member.summary: Canon makernote. Standard IFD without a special prefix.

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType.Panasonic
member.summary: Panasonic makernote. "Panasonic\0\0\0" prefix and IFD starting at offset 12. The next-IFD pointer is missing

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType.Leica
member.summary: Leica makernote. "LEICA\0\0\0" prefix and IFD starting at offset 10.

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType.Pentax
member.summary: Pentax makernote. "AOC\0" + 2 unknown bytes as prefix. The IFD starts at offset 6.

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType.Nikon1
member.summary: Nikon makernote (type 1). Standard IFD without a special prefix.

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType.Nikon2
member.summary: Nikon makernote (type 2). "Nikon\0" + 2 unknown bytes prefix. The IFD starts at offset 8.

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType.Nikon3
member.summary: Nikon makernote (type 3). "Nikon\0" + 4 bytes with verison code + Tiff header. The IFD starts usually at offset 18. The offsets of the IFD are relative to start of the Tiff header (byte 10)

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType.Olympus1
member.summary: Olympus makernote (type 1). "OLYMP\0" + 2 unknown bytes as prefix. The IFD starts at offset 8.

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType.Olympus2
member.summary: Olympus makernote (type 2) "OLYMPUS\0II" + 2 unknown bytes as prefix. The IFD starts at offset 12. The offsets of the IFD are relative to the beginning of the makernote.

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType.Sony
member.summary: Sony makernote (type 1). "SONY DSC \0\0\0" as prefix. The IFD starts at offset 12. A next-IFD pointer is missing.

member.name: T:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteIFDEntry
member.summary: Contains a Makernote IFD.
member.remarks: Makernote IFDs are mostly of the same form. They start with and Manufactor specific prefix indicating the type and contain then a IFD structure. It must be distinguished, where the offsets in the IFD belongs to. For some makernotes the offset refers to the beginning of the surrounding metadata IFD structure, for others they refer to the start of the makernote. In addition the endianess of the makernote can be different to the endianess of the surrounding metadata. This class takes care about all those things.

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteIFDEntry.prefix
member.value: Stores the prefix of the makernote

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteIFDEntry.ifd_offset
member.value: Stores the offset of the IFD contained in makernote

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteIFDEntry.absolute_offset
member.value: Indicates, if the offsets are relative to the current makernote or absolut to the base_offset of the surrounding IFD.

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteIFDEntry.is_bigendian
member.value: Stores, if the makernote is encoded in big- or little endian. If the field is , the endianess of the surrounding IFD is used.

member.name: P:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteIFDEntry.Tag
member.value: The ID of the tag, the current instance belongs to

member.name: P:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteIFDEntry.MakernoteType
member.value: The type of the makernote the current instance represents

member.name: P:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteIFDEntry.Structure
member.value: The pure which is stored by the makernote.

member.name: M:TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteIFDEntry.#ctor(System.UInt16,TagLib.IFD.IFDStructure,TagLib.IFD.Entries.MakernoteType,TagLib.ByteVector,System.UInt32,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Construcor.
member.param: A with the tag ID of the entry this instance represents
A with the IFD structure, which is stored by this instance
A with the type of the makernote.
A containing the prefix, which should be rendered before the real IFD.
A with the offset in addition to the relative offsets in the IFD
A indicating if the offsets of the IFD are relative to the , or absolut to the base offset of the surrounding IFD.
A indicating if the current IFD is encoded in big- or little endian. It it is , the endianess of the surrounding IFD is used.

member.summary: Constructor. Reads an IFD from given file, using the given endianness.
member.param: A to read from.
A , it must be true, if the data of the IFD should be read as bigendian, otherwise false.
A that will be populated.

A value describing the base were the IFD offsets refer to. E.g. in Jpegs the IFD are located in an Segment and the offsets inside the IFD refer from the beginning of this segment. So must contain the beginning of the segment.
A value with the beginning of the IFD relative to .
A value with maximal possible offset. This is to limit the size of the possible data;

member.name: M:TagLib.IFD.IFDReader.Read
member.summary: Read all IFD segments from the file.

member.name: M:TagLib.IFD.IFDReader.Read(System.Int32)
member.summary: Read IFD segments from the file.
member.para: The number of IFDs that may be read can be restricted using the count parameter. This might be needed for fiels that have invalid next-ifd pointers (such as some IFDs in the Nikon Makernote). This condition is tested in the Nikon2 unit test, which contains such a file.
member.param: A with the maximal number of IFDs to read. Passing -1 means unlimited.

member.summary: Add to the reference count for the IFD loop detection.

member.summary: Attempts to detect whether or not this file has an endless IFD loop.
member.param: A with the offset at which the next IFD can be found.
member.returns: True if we have gone into a loop, false otherwise.

member.name: M:TagLib.IFD.IFDReader.StopIFDLoopDetect
member.summary: End the IFD loop detection, cleanup if we're the last.

member.name: M:TagLib.IFD.IFDReader.CreateIFDEntry(System.UInt16,System.UInt16,System.UInt32,System.Int64,TagLib.ByteVector,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates an IFDEntry from the given values. This method is used for every entry. Custom parsing can be hooked in by overriding the method.
member.param: A with the tag of the entry.
A with the type of the entry.
A with the data count of the entry.
A with the base offset which every offsets in the IFD are relative to.

A containing exactly 4 byte with the data of the offset of the entry. Since this field isn't interpreted as an offset if the data can be directly stored in the 4 byte, we pass the to easier interpret it.
A with the maximal offset to consider for the IFD.

member.name: M:TagLib.IFD.IFDReader.ReadAsciiString(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads an ASCII string from the current file.
member.returns: A read from the current instance.
member.remarks: The exif standard allows to store multiple string separated by '\0' in one ASCII-field. On the other hand some programs (e.g. CanonZoomBrowser) fill some ASCII fields by trailing '\0's. We follow the Adobe practice as described in XMP Specification Part 3 (Storeage in Files), and process the ASCII string only to the first '\0'.

A instance which was read and needs fixes.

A with the offset of the IFD

member.summary: Renders a complete entry together with the data. The entry itself is stored in and the data of the entry is stored in if it cannot be stored in the offset. This method is called for every of this IFD and can be overwritten in subclasses to provide special behavior.

member.name: T:TagLib.IFD.IFDTag

member.summary: A reference to the Exif IFD (which can be found by following the pointer in IFD0, ExifIFD tag). This variable should not be used directly, use the property instead.

member.name: F:TagLib.IFD.IFDTag.gps_ifd

member.name: P:TagLib.IFD.IFDTag.ExifIFD
member.summary: The Exif IFD. Will create one if the file doesn't alread have it.

remarks.para: Note how this also creates an empty IFD for exif, even if you don't set a value. That's okay, empty nested IFDs get ignored when rendering.

member.name: P:TagLib.IFD.IFDTag.GPSIFD
member.summary: The GPS IFD. Will create one if the file doesn't alread have it.

remarks.para: Note how this also creates an empty IFD for GPS, even if you don't set a value. That's okay, empty nested IFDs get ignored when rendering.

member.value: A with the altitude. A positive value is above sea level, a negative one below sea level. The unit is meter.

member.value: A containing the orientation of the image

member.value: A with the manufacture name.

member.name: T:TagLib.Image.Codec
member.summary: A photo codec. Contains basic photo details.

member.name: P:TagLib.Image.Codec.Duration
member.summary: Gets the duration of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A containing the duration of the media represented by the current instance.

member.name: P:TagLib.Image.Codec.MediaTypes
member.summary: Gets the types of media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A bitwise combined containing the types of media represented by the current instance.

member.name: P:TagLib.Image.Codec.Description
member.summary: Gets a text description of the media represented by the current instance.
member.value: A object containing a description of the media represented by the current instance.

member.name: P:TagLib.Image.Codec.PhotoWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the photo represented by the current instance.
member.value: A value containing the width of the photo represented by the current instance.

member.name: P:TagLib.Image.Codec.PhotoHeight
member.summary: Gets the height of the photo represented by the current instance.
member.value: A value containing the height of the photo represented by the current instance.

member.name: P:TagLib.Image.Codec.PhotoQuality
member.summary: Gets the (format specific) quality indicator of the photo represented by the current instance.
member.value: A value indicating the quality. A value 0 means that there was no quality indicator for the format or the file.

member.name: M:TagLib.Image.Codec.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new with the given width and height.
member.param: The width of the photo.
The height of the photo.
member.returns: A new instance.

member.name: M:TagLib.Image.Codec.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new with the given width and height.
member.param: The width of the photo.
The height of the photo.
The quality indicator for the photo, if the format supports it.
member.returns: A new instance.

member.name: T:TagLib.Image.CombinedImageTag
member.summary: Combines some instance to behave as one.

member.summary: Direct access to the Exif (IFD) tag (if any)

member.summary: Other image tags available in this tag.

member.summary: Stores the types of the tags, which are allowed for the current instance.

member.name: P:TagLib.Image.CombinedImageTag.AllTags
member.summary: Returns all image tags in this tag, with XMP and Exif first.

member.name: M:TagLib.Image.CombinedImageTag.#ctor(TagLib.TagTypes)
member.summary: Constructs and initializes a new instance of with a restriction on the allowed tag types contained in this combined tag.
member.param: A value, which restricts the types of metadata that can be contained in this combined tag.

member.summary: Clears all of the child tags.

member.name: T:TagLib.Image.ImageBlockFile
member.summary: Some image file formats are organized as a sequence of mostly independent data blocks whose order can be changed. Metadata is stored in some of those blocks and when metadata is saved, often the same task remains: Delete some blocks which contain metadata and overwrite some blocks with other metadata. This class extends to provide this functionality. Blocks can be marked as metadata and when metadata is saved their space is used or they are deleted.

member.name: T:TagLib.Image.ImageBlockFile.MetadataBlock
member.summary: This class represents a metadata block to overwrite.

member.summary: The start index
